plots: Lord Taldimut has been studying the crests
title: The Lost Key
objective: help Lord Taldimut bring the Golden Gear to Zeryphesh
description: I have continued studying the crests, and I am more convinced than ever that the Golden Gear is hidden in the the Whispering Cave. If you can retrieve it, I can bring it back to Zeryphesh, to aid in the city's defense against the Ezrohir siege.

plots: NONE
title: Bring Out Your Dead
objective: recover the Rosamortis for Selrenki
tasks: convince the spirits to unlock the Ghost Chains
get the Rosamortis away from its big undead guardian
description:
I got a proposition for you... a little "I scratch my back, you scratch yours" kind of thing. See this crypt over here? It's called the Bone Gallery, and there's a little thing in there called the Rosamortis... a handy little thingamajig that can save the life of someone who's been mortally wounded... which, while pretty valuable, is also guarded by the biggest undead monstrosity I've ever seen!
Also, the entrance to the Bone Gallery is locked with chains only a ghost can open! You'll have to convince the spirits to unlock the Ghost Chains and give you access, then get the Rosamortis away from that monster... but I promise to make it worth your while!

plots: if the attackers have breached the inner courtyard of the de'Arnise Keep, they will be hard to rout
Nalia de'Arnise's father would not leave the de'Arnise Keep
title: The de'Arnise Keep Has Been Invaded
objective: defeat the attackers at the de'Arnise Keep
description:
I, Nalia de'Arnise, need a strong hand to help me. My land is under siege, and none of this rabble will aid me! And after all I've done for their kind, too! Please, can you assist me?
There is no time! I only hope that the attackers have not made it inside. If they have... if they have breached the inner courtyard, they will be hard to rout.
I will tell you what secrets I can. Perhaps you will be able to sneak in and attack from a more vulnerable spot. I hope Father is all right. He... would not leave.
Please, hurry to the de'Arnise Keep and find Daleson.

BG292: a tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District

plots: Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows were on a mission to obtain the Book of Kaza for a book collector
Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows had a heated argument: only Korgan Bloodaxe remained alive afterwards
title: Help Korgan Recover the Book of Kaza
objective: bring the the Book of Kaza to the book collector
tasks: find the Book of Kaza with Korgan Bloodaxe
description:
I'm scouring for a band of desperate adventurers to aid me in a gallant task. Come and hear Korgan Bloodaxe's tale!
A fortnight past, me fellows and I were in the midst of obtaining an ancient text fer our patron when a skirmish visited our midst. Vile words, alas, became a lake of bloodshed. So it goes the sacred grimoire ne'er made it to our benefactor's hand. And now he awaits its arrival with a zeal reserved for a grog-blossom in an alekeg. The scuttlebutt is the pay is handsome and worthy of note — sacks of loot and odd magics. The volume sits not far from 'ere, and the bibliomaniac, he paces the floor in the meantime. 'Tis called the Book of Kaza.
The Book of Kaza is in some hobnail's tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District. It's nae abandoned, but rumors and half-truths only scare the young and infirm. Keeps the curious away, me guess.
Well... it'll take far more than a few shambling bags of skin and stitches to deter Korgan Bloodaxe from a king's ransom! A foolhardy jaunt into a hive of undead? How could ye resist?

plots: Casson was killed for trespassing the Water Queen's House
Tremain Belde'ar wants to resurrect Casson
title: Tremain's Son
objective: bring Casson's body to Tremain Belde'ar
description:
Greetings to you. I am Lord Priest Tremain Belde'ar, a humble servant of Our Smiling Lady Tymora.
My request of you is an odd and very dangerous one. I will not hold you to it if you deem it too extreme. I would have you enter the Water Queen's House and retrieve my son's, Casson's, body. Casson sought to indulge his restless nature by sneaking about the place, and a high price was paid.
You must bring Casson's body to me, that I may restore his life to him.

BG1263: Merchants' League Counting House, northeast section of Baldur's Gate, northeast from Elfsong Tavern

plots: The Merchants' League found Balduran's shipwreck on Balduran's Island
Mendas of Waterdeep wants to get Balduran's logbook before the merchants destroy it while they search for treasure
The Merchants' League keeps the sea charts locked up
Mendas of Waterdeep will give the player some gold to obtain the sea charts
title: The Reclusive Scholar
objective: travel to Balduran's Island to find Balduran's logbook for Mendas of Waterdeep
tasks: obtain the sea charts from the sea captain
description:
I am Mendas of Waterdeep, quester of small truth in this land. I am in need of favor from you. Can you help a gentle fellow in search for knowledge?
The Merchants' League sailors found Balduran's shipwreck on a small island. I wish to recover the ship's logbook. I will solve mystery of Balduran's final voyage. Merchants' League will destroy my artifacts to get treasure. This must not happen! If you help me, I get things precious to me, you get treasure, merchant men get nothing. You will help, yes?
These men that find island, they keep the sea charts locked up. In Baldur's Gate, there is building in northeast section of city called Merchants' League Counting House. To find it, just go northeast from Elfsong Tavern. The sea charts, they are in there. Most likely, captain of ship will have them. I don't know such things as chart retrieval, but you are hero, and it is no problem for heroes.
There might be small danger, so I give you some gold for the charts.

plots: the player found Trill-Bot 4000's body, which stores his memories
title: Loose Connections
objective: reacquire the rest of Trill-Bot 4000's components
description:
It appears you have found my body. Very good. This is where my memories are stored … including the locations of multiple caches of treasure. I could share these with you, if you would help me reacquire the rest of my components.
We should begin with my Cognition Linkage. Without that, I won't be able to do much more than repeat this message. My sensors tell me it is somewhere nearby. Find it and reinstall it, and I will direct you to one of those treasure troves.

plots: Modryn Oreyn has one final duty for the player to perform
everyone is in danger, as long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap from the Hist Tree
Ri'Zakar will have the Hist Tree well guarded
title: The Hist
objective: return to the Blackwood Company hall to destroy the Hist Tree and anyone that stands in your way
tasks: find Ri'Zakar's key that opens the door to the Hist tree
description:
It is time for decisive action. I have one more duty for you to perform. It is clear to me what must be done. The Hist Tree must be destroyed. This tree is the source of our problems. It is an abomination of nature, and it must be destroyed. As long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap, we are all in danger. I fear they no longer know what they do.
You must find a way to destroy the Hist, though I can imagine Ri'Zakar will have it well guarded. He's a warrior, a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel. He'll keep his prize tree locked away. You'll need to find his key.
Expect an unfriendly welcome at their hall. Finish it.

plots: Big Head will give the player his charm so that the player can speak with Bolwing
title: The Fork of Horripilation
objective: find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
tasks: talk to Bolwing to hear his secret
description:
Sing for Big Head.
The Fork for Big Head. Oh, where has Master put the Fork? It sings alone. Far from home. Sad, sad Fork. Sad, sad Big Head.
The Fork! The precious, precious fork! Hear how it sings to Big Head! Beautiful, perfect Fork of Horripilation! But it is gone. Gone, gone, gone. No more singing. No more ringing. Taken from Big Head, never returned. That is when Big Head came here. Master brought me! Whispered shouts into my ear! Songs of Madgods! Songs of bad gods! Softly, Master. Softly.
It went away. But it will come back! It always comes back! It is close. Big Head can hear it! The Fork of Horripilation! Hear it singing! Songs of home! It comes again. It brings presents! It is not present. Soon it will be! You will find it! Bring the Fork! Hear the music. Music of toads. Music of roads! Sing to yourself, so all can hear!
Talk to the beggar! Talk to Bolwing! He knows secrets, but no one can hear them. No one but Big Head. Take Big Head's charm! Listen to Bolwing! His tongue is tied, but his mind is unraveled! He'll tell you the secret. Who has the Fork?

plots: Inkspot wants knowledge
NONE
title: Connecting the Dots
objective: bring Inkspot's map to Mapmaker, and return to Inkspot
description:
Oh my! I'm supposed to deliver a map of mine to one of my colleagues in another village, but I just can't ever spare the time
You seen to have a lot of time on your hands. Could you please deliver my map to Mapmaker in Rivermouth? He'd be grateful to you; he has wanted to examine this particular map for a long time. Upon your return, I'd give you a little something for your help.

plots: the player is meeting Arch-Mage Traven face-to-face for the first time
Raminus has told Arch-Mage Traven good things about the player: the player has advanced quickly, and shows great promise

the Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time: Mucianus Allias was sent to infiltrate the ranks of the necromancers, but he stopped sending reports to the Council of Mages
the Council of Mages distrusts Mucianus Allias, unlike Arch-Mage Traven
title: Liberation or Apprehension?
objective: locate Mucianus Allias, and return him safely to the Arcane University
tasks: find Mucianus Allias before the battlemages of the Mages Guild apprehend him
description:
Greetings. It is high time that we met face to face, don't you think? Raminus has told me good things about you. You have advanced quickly, and show great promise. I now intend to put your talents to a more direct test.
I have a difficult task that you can, perhaps, assist with. Let me explain what is at stake. The Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time. It had been our position to sit back and watch what unfolded, but that time has clearly passed. We cannot tolerate these attacks on the guild. Most of our information on Necromancers has come from an informant inside the cult itself, a guild member who offered to infiltrate their ranks.
Though the information he has provided is limited, it has given us a sense of their scope and power. The Council was initially reluctant to believe the information was reliable, but with recent events, they have little choice but to trust it. I fear that our informant is in danger, and that is why I have called you here.
The informant is a mage called Mucianus Allias. He is not a Council member, but has long served the guild here at the Arcane University. Aware in the growing interest in the guild after the band of Necromancy was put into place, he offered to help the Council track the cult's actions. With my blessing, he infiltrated the group, and has fed us information for quite some time, until recently. I have not heard from him, and I fear for his safety.
The lack of reports from Mucianus has disturbed the Council, and they are now concerned about the legitimacy of his information. A group of Battlemages were dispatched to Mucianus's last know location, with the intent on bringing him in for questioning. I argued against it, but eventually agreed to maintain order in the Council. I regret that decision, and that is why I wish to send you there. I fear the Battlemages may mistreat Mucianus, if they do not mistake him for one of the many Necromancers no doubt present in the ruins.
I wish for you to find Mucianus, and ensure his safe return to the Arcane University. I do not want anything to go wrong. Please, hurry. The Battlemages will arrive there soon, if they have not already, and time is of the essence. If for any reason they are unsuccessful, Mucianus' life will be forfeit. You must make sure he is safe. Go now, and bring word to me as soon as he has been escorted to safety. Mucianus last reported being sent to the ruins of Nenyond Twyll, south of the Imperial City. That is where the Battlemages went. South of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr. I'm afraid I know nothing more about the location, or what you may expect to find once you arrive.

plots: the player asked Andragil to train the player in blocking
title: Block Training
objective: demonstrate your blocking skills to Andragil
tasks: block Andragil's attacks with your shield
description:
You want training, from me? Well, perhaps I can accommodate you. If you're worth the time and effort, that is. I think a little test is in order.
Thinking you know how to use a shield is one thing. Actually using one is quite another. So here's what we're going to do. We're going to find out whether or not you can hold up in combat. You put up your shield, and I hit you. If you're still standing when I'm done, you've earned the right to learn what I have to teach.
Shall we find out what you really know? Now, put up your guard, and let's begin. I'm losing interest in this.

plots: NONE
title: Stealing Plans
objective: steal the plans of the Silver Hand
tasks: sneak into a Silver Hand camp
description:
I've caught wind that one of the brighter Silver Hand has been sniffing around Eastmarch.
If you can sneak into the Silver Hand camp and steal their plans, we'll have the advantage. Hopefully the plans will let us know more about their movement.

plots: Laila Law-Giver gives the player the key to the warehouse
title: The Raid
objective: help Laila Law-Giver to uncover and stop the illegal Skooma trade in Riften
tasks: convince Sarthis close down his Skooma operation permanently
description:
We're aware of a Skooma dealer's presence in the warehouse within this city. Unfortunately, we're certain this Skooma dealer, Sarthis, has informants within the city guard. Every time we've made a move to arrest him, he's escaped.
However, if you'd take care of this discreetly, you might be able to surprise him without warning. Here, this is the key to the warehouse. See if you can drop in on this dealer of poison and convince him to close down his operation permanently.

plots: the player survived Fazeer Shah's first task with the Tu'tara
title: The Djinni's Next Task
objective: complete Fazeer Shah's second task
description:
You survived the Tu'tara more or less in one piece. Congratulations. But it occurs to me that you didn't do anything that you wouldn't ordinarily have done. This second task should prove much more amusing.
Step through the Portal. Your second task... is to survive!

TESO425: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala
TESO427: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala

plots: the player reunited Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane
ogres attacked Weatherleah when Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane were little children: Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's parents fled from Weatherleah
Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's father carried Guilbert Jemane to safety and later returned to Weatherleah believing Reynald Jemane and the boys' mother had perished
Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's mother carried Reynald to safety: their mother did not survive
title: Legacy Lost
objective: help Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane recover Weatherleah
tasks: find Weatherleah, and see if it is still inhabited by ogres
description:
I can't thank you enough for helping to reunite me with Reynald. I never would have guessed he was still alive. We have much to discuss, but if you have time, I'd beg you stay a moment longer and hear about our home, Weatherleah.
Weatherleah was our family's home for generations. Our parents fled it when ogres attacked; they became separated. My father carried me to safety. He later returned and believed Reynald and my mother had perished. Since ogres are cannibals, he didn't expect to find their bodies. Thankfully, however, it seems that my mother managed to carry Reynald to safety. While my mother didn't survive, Reynald did, and for that I'm grateful.
But we both want more - we want our home back. We're not fighters; you appear to have more skill than either of us. Would you go to Weatherleah, and see if it's still inhabited by ogres?
Now, we're not quite sure where the estate is located. We'll offer up what we know, however. We believe it's somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala. It may be difficult to find. Since no one's lived there for many years, it may be quite overgrown by now.
If you find Weatherleah, let us know. We'll be waiting anxiously.

plots: the player told J'bari that they want light armor training from him
title: Light Armor Training
objective: give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
description:
If you want training from me, you're going to have to get something for me first.
I need a new Elven cuirass. Nothing fancy, nothing enchanted. Just a decent piece of armor. You get that for me, and I'll train you. That's the deal.

plots: Potema was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago: Styrr has a book about Potema
one of Potema's servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines
the player was there when Potema was summoned in spirit form
Styrr helps the player with Potema's minions
title: The Wolf Queen Awakened
objective: stop Potema from returning to the living
tasks: find Potema's skeleton and remove it from the catacombs
bring Potema's skeleton back to be sanctified by Arkay
description:
Ah Potema, the Wolf Queen. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history. She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
And now Potema has been summoned in spirit form. Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs. A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
You were there when Potema was summoned. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to stop her from returning to the living. I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.

plots: Sir Casimir followed Sir Berich into a war after the Order fractured
the war changed Sir Casimir: he no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering
after the war, Sir Casimir tried to serve the Nine at the Chapel of Stendarr in Chorrol
Sir Casimir was cursed after killing a beggar at the Chapel of Stendarr: he was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything
the Gauntlets of the Crusader slipped from Sir Casimir's hands after killing the beggar: they are still in the Chapel of Stendarr, too heavy to move
title: Stendarr's Mercy
objective: retrieve the Gauntlets of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: talk to the priests of Stendarr
description:
I, Sir Casimir, know where you may find the Gauntlets of the Crusader, for I was the one who lost them when I was still alive. Though many know where they are, they are still lost. I believe there is something you must do in order to retrieve them.
When the Order fractured, I followed Sir Berich into war, taking the Gauntlets with me. When it was over, I returned to this land. I attempted to return to the service of the Nine, but the war had changed me. I no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering. In the brief time I was there, I did more to hurt the Chapel of Stendarr than help it. It was there that I was cursed.
A beggar who came to the Chapel each day for help tried my patience one too many times. I lost my temper, and struck him. My blow landed harder than I had intended, and he fell to the floor, dead. Killed in the very Chapel of the God of Mercy. I left the Chapel at once, of course, but the damage was done. I was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything.
As proof of the deed, when I struck the poor man the Gauntlets slipped right off my hands and fell to the floor. Heavy as stone, they would not move. None could lift them. I suspect they lie there still, in Chorrol's Chapel. You must prove to Stendarr you are worthy to lift the Gauntlets once more. Seek out the priests of Stendarr in Chorrol. Perhaps they can help you.

plots: NONE
title: A Trip to Eternity
objective: assassinate Ma'randru-jo
description:
Ma'randru-jo is an accomplished wizard, and your assassination target. Locating him may be challenging, as he travels with the caravans.
Those caravaners can be an elusive bunch. Takes a fair bit of stalking to take one down. But then, that's half the fun, isn't it?

plots: the player told Alvor that there was a dragon in Helgen
title: Before the Storm
objective: inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
description:
What? A dragon? In Helgen? That explains what I saw earlier... a dragon flying down from the south... I was hoping I was wrong about what I thought it was... Didn't want to believe my own eyes, is all.
The Jarl needs to know if there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.

TL2126: Warbeast den, in the Bone Defile
TL2128: Warbeast den, in the Bone Defile

plots: NONE
title: Angry Beasts
objective: calm down the Warbeasts
tasks: get rid of whatever's making the Warbeasts vicious
description:
I've been charged with culling the Warbeasts here, for the Imperial colonization effort. I can keep their population down, but something is driving them wild, almost like they're rabid or something.
Can you get into the Warbeast den, in the Bone Defile, and get rid of whatever's making them so vicious?

MC185: diamond veins deep in the ground
MC186: diamond veins deep in the ground

plots: Pate wants equipment
the player is a friend of Pate
title: Deal of the Century
objective: bring 2 blocks of diamond to Pate
description:
My friend, I've got a profitable deal for you today. As you know, I smith weapons from a variety of materials, including diamond.
Just so it happens, I'm running low on diamonds: soon I can't make any diamond swords for daring adventurers. I'm not skilled in adventuring; I can't brave the deep underground for diamond veins.
Yet, I have a whopping block of Netherite. You definitely don't see those every day! Here's the deal: bring me 2 blocks of diamond, and I'll give you my block of Netherite. A good deal for a good friend.

plots: NONE
title: Ore Identification
objective: pick up an ore sample for Hafjorg for identification
tasks: speak to Filnjar to get the ore sample
description:
I swear, if I wasn't around, Elgrim would forget to eat his meals. How we make any coin at all is beyond me.
In fact, I need to arrange for someone to pick up an ore sample for me in Shor's Stone... goodness knows Elgrim won't lift a finger to do it.
You would do this for me? Oh, that would be wonderful. Speak to Filnjar in Shor's Stone. He's got some sort of ore sample he wants us to identify and was willing to pay us well for it.
The job pays well, so I hope I can make arrangements soon. We could really use the gold. I'll have Elgrim make some potions for you for all that travel.

plots: the bandit leader thinks that his men are going to mutiny: Herd and Brodir are leading their own cliques within the bandits
the bandit leader is going to gather up gold and escape downriver to Dragon Bridge
title: Robber's Stash
objective: find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
tasks: go to the island to the south and find the old tree stump
description:
Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.

plots: the passage to Vahlok's Tomb must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions
title: Lost Legacy
objective: protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
description:
Yes, I think you're just the adventurous sort I need. I have a job offer for you.
As a scholar of history, I've always found Solstheim to be most intriguing. I've made many forays into the ancient ruins that cover the island. I've come to know those ruins so well, I could draw you a map from memory. That's why I noticed the new passage the moment I laid eyes on it.
it leads to an old tomb, I think. It must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions. I'd love to have a closer look, but those old ruins can be dangerous and I'm no adventurer. I'll pay you to watch my back down there.
I'll be heading back there soon. If you're interested, meet me at the ruins and we'll see what we can find. Now I'm off to pack for the expedition!

plots: Yves wants reputation
NONE
title: Tales of Terror
objective: visit a Nether Fortress, and report back to Yves
description:
I love to tell stories to others. I'd like to bolster my reputation as a storyteller with some novel, unheard stories about the Nether. To recount its dangers and hellish nature...
A witness' account of a Nether Fortress would help me devise some dashing tales. A terrible fortress with equally terrible inhabitants...
Would you be my witness? Please, go to the Nether and find a Nether Fortress. Visit it, and tell me all about it. I'll have a diamond for you. It should entice you to help me.

plots: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Metrich wants some squatters removed from his lands: the squatters used violence against Metrich's men
title: Dealing with the Baron
objective: restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute
tasks: Go to a neutral meeting place.
description:
Knight, we have been commissioned by a local barony. Such service to political figures is good for the Order, and you will serve quite well in the task.
It is necessary for us to be accessible in local concerns lest we seem above the people. In this case, a baron has petitioned us to solve a land dispute. Baron Metrich wishes some squatters removed and has cited violence against his men as reason for it. Go to his lands, restore order, and bring favor to us.
The baron waits in a neutral meeting place. He is in a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale. Go now.

plots: Runil became a priest of Arkay after the Great War: many died by Runil's magics
Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept Runil as one of their own
title: A Journal of Regret
objective: retrieve Runil's journal for him
description:
I am Runil, a priest of Arkay. I came into Arkay's light after the Great War. So many died by my hands, my magics.
I'm fortunate that Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept me as one of their own.
Could you do an old elf a favor? I misplaced my journal in a cave I was exploring. I'll pay for its return.
Blessing of Arkay to you for your help.

plots: wants knowledge
the player is a famous hero
title: Lurkers in Shadows
objective: find out what the suspicious person is after
tasks: find and follow the suspicious person at dusk
description:
I almost didn't see you there, Hero. I'm succumbed in deep, dark thoughts at the moment.
Someone's been spying on our village for quite some time. I personally spotted that suspicious individual coming here around dusk.
Perhaps that person is plotting something malicious, perhaps not. Regardless, I'm worried that something bad might happen to Cocoa Hamlet. You, Hero, are the right person to find out what that suspicious person is up to. The jungle can hide many dangers in its deep thickets of trees and vines. Find and follow the suspicious person, here in Cocoa Hamlet.
We can give you a diamond for your time. An adventurer found it in an abandoned jungle temple a long time ago.

TESS38: Jiub the Eradicator, Saint Jiub, Jiub

plots: NONE
title: Impatience of a Saint
objective: help Jiub find the first volume of his opus
tasks: collect the ten missing pages of Jiub's opus
description:
I am Jiub. Some call me Saint Jiub. Others call me Jiub the Eradicator. Perhaps you've heard of me?
If you haven't, I can't say that I am surprised. Until I get my second volume published, no one will ever know of my achievements. In order to write the second volume of my opus, I need the notes from my first volume. Otherwise I need to do all of this from memory.
When I was tossed in here I felt myself falling… and I dropped the pages I had been holding. There were ten of them in all.
Find them for me, please, I beg you!

plots: the Empire demanded Skald the Elder to leave giants be, but the Imperial authority does not apply here anymore
title: Kill the Giant
objective: slay a giant
description:
Giants are a common problem in the Pale. The Empire always demanded I leave them be, but the Empire isn't here now.
Go and slay one of the beasts. It should let them know that Dawnstar is not to be trifled with. I'm counting on you.

plots: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
as the player can see, the Black Hand have dealt with Lucien Lachance
Lucien Lachance tricked the player to kill the Black Hand off: the player killed the Listener and the Listener's successor
Arquen promotes the player to Speaker from Silencer: the player becomes a member of the Black Hand
there are only five members of the Black Hand, including the player
title: Honor Thy Mother
objective: perform an ancient ritual to wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance
tasks: ask about the Night Mother from Arquen between 12.00 PM and 3:00 AM
go to the Night Mother's home with Arquen
description:
Silencer! At last you've arrived! Fear not, for the crisis that has threatened the Dark Brotherhood has finally come to an end. I am Arquen, Speaker for the Black Hand.
As you can see, we have dealt with the betrayer, Lucien Lachance! No longer will you serve as his puppet! It seems Lachance wanted revenge against the Dark Brotherhood for some reason, and used you to do his dirty work. But now, we can begin anew!
I bestow upon you the title of Speaker. You will take Lucien Lachance's place on the Black Hand! Welcome! As you know, the Black Hand is now in a state of disarray. Lachance ordered you to kill us off! We five, including you, are now all that remain. Even worse, you killed the Listener! The Black Hand without a Listener is like a hand with no thumb. Even the Listener's successor is dead!
So, we have no choice but to invoke an ancient ritual. We must wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance! Between the hours of midnight and 3:00 AM, ask me about the Night Mother, and we will away to our Lady's home in Bravil. Only then will the ritual begin.
May the Night Mother hold you in her cold embrace.

plots: Reynald Jemane has never been to Cheydinhal
title: Separated at Birth
objective: investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
tasks: find the person whose impersonating Reynald Jemane and tell him to stop
description:
If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times. I've NEVER been to Cheydinhal! I... oh, hang on. You're someone else. Apologies, my good friend, I mistook you for someone else. Always being asked about it, I am. 'Didn't I see you in Cheydinhal?', they say. Well I'm sick of it. Sick and tired, tired and sick. And perhaps a little drunk. But never mind. You look like the honest sort, so I've a job for you.
You're going to travel to Cheydinhal, and find out what sort of impostor is trying to besmirch my good name. And you're going to tell him... *hic*... You're going to tell him I am quite capable of besmirching my good name on my own. He should cease and desist immediately. There's fifty gold pieces in it for you, friend...

TESS69: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead
TESS70: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead
TESS72: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead

plots: NONE
title: A False Front
objective: deliver false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal
tasks: convince an innkeeper to help you locate an Imperial runner, get the Imperial orders from the runner, and replace them with forgeries
description:
I Need you to deliver some false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal. But first we need to get our hands on some Imperial orders to make the forgeries.
The inns at Dragon Bridge and Rorikstead are frequent stops for Imperial runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Talos guide you.

plots: the player is an Associate of the mages' guild
another Associate tossed the Ring of Burden down the locked well behind the guild hall
title: Falcar's Recommendation
objective: retrieve the Ring of Burden for Falcar
tasks: get the key to the locked well from Deetsan
description:
What is it, Associate? Don't tell me you're here for a recommendation from me.
There was a particular Ring of Burden I was testing some time ago. Another stupid Associate somehow got his hands on it, and managed to misplace it. If I didn't know better, I'd say he purposely tossed it down the well behind the guild hall. Why he would do such a thing is beyond me.
You will retrieve this ring for me. Should you manage to do so, I shall consider sending a recommendation to the Arcane University.
The well is locked, so you'll need the key. Deetsan should have a copy of it. Now get moving.

plots: Marek has poisoned the player: the player has 10 days to live
Lothander wants to help the player get an antidote to the poison
Lothander was forced to work for the Iron Throne with a geas
title: Marek and Lothander
objective: get an antidote before you die of Marek's poison
tasks: talk to Haspur who can possibly reverse Lothander's geas
description:
I am Lothander.
I do not wish you harm. My partner, Marek, has poisoned you. While you slept, he slipped a slow-acting magical poison into your food. You have about ten days to live. Common priest spells won't help you. Only one thing can, and that's the antidote. I can help you find it, if you help me first.
My problem is this: I don't work for the Iron Throne because I wish to but rather because I have been forced. I have been enspelled with a geas. If I do not obey everything that Marek orders of me the spell will take effect and I shall waste away. I need a way to rid myself of the spell. I know of a diviner at the market square who may have the answers I seek, but I don't have the money to pay him. Will you help me?

plots: the player has volunteered to close the Oblivion Gate: Savlian Matius sent men in the Oblivion Gate to see if they could find a way to shut it
title: Breaking the Siege of Kvatch
objective: help defeat the Daedra invaders, and end the siege of Kvatch
description:
You want to help? You're kidding, right? Hmm... if you're serious, maybe I can put you to use. It'll likely mean your death, though.
I don't know how to close this Gate, but it must be possible, because the enemy closed the ones they opened during the initial attack. You can see the marks on the ground where they were, with the Great Gate right in the middle. I sent men into the Gate, to see if they could find a way to shut it. They haven't come back. If you can get in there, find out what happened to them. If they're alive, help them finish the job. If not, see what you can do on your own.
The best I can say is, good luck. If you make it back alive, we'll be waiting for you. It's a brave thing you're doing.

plots: NONE
title: Song of the Alchemists
objective: bring Lami "Song of the Alchemists"
description:
I'm Lami, an alchemist. I picked up the alchemy trade when I was a girl. One of the temple healers staying here on a pilgrimage showed me the basics.
She had a book with her, "Song of the Alchemists", that I used to read over and over. I miss having a copy.
Could you find that book for me? I'd be happy to show you a bit about herbs if you find the book.

plots: Mirili Ulven gives the player a list of plants she needs
title: Taxonomy of Obsession
objective: help Mirili Ulven finish her research
description:
I am Mirili Ulven, a botanist.
You're offering to help me with my research? Well... I suppose I could find a use for you, despite your lack of training. Collect some plants for me, will you?
Here's the list of things I need. Get me everything on it. Try to remember where you found it so you can tell me. It's important.
I will pay you 10 gold coins for each sample.

plots: if the player bumps into Indaryn, they should not tell him anything about Romlyn Dreth's dealings
title: Under the Table
objective: make a delivery for Romlyn Dreth
tasks: smuggle a small Black-Briar Mead keg to Wilhelm
description:
I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Black-Briar Meadery.
If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious. I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork.
Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

TESS308: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings
TESS312: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings

plots: Arondil used to live in Dawnstar: his house was burned down when his necromantic experiments became public knowledge
title: Toying With The Dead
objective: retrieve the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals for Vekel the Man
tasks: find the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals
description:
I have a buyer with a very odd taste in literature, looking for some particular books.
I'm told they're the ravings of a madman, a wizard named Arondil, and his peculiar cravings. It's said to be in four volumes and very hard to come by. My client is offering quite a reward for them, which I'd split with you.
Recently, a woman was found... naked and shivering along the road to Dawnstar. The only information the guard could get from her were tales of strange experiments and Arondil scribbling in his journals.
He used to have a home in Dawnstar until they burned it down. The people say he was doing unspeakable experiments on reanimation... rituals only a necromancer would perform. After he made for Yngvild, he was never heard from again.
In his later years, Arondil moved into some ice caves known as Yngvild. He preferred the solitude in which to perform his, um... experiments.

BG1215: Ragefast's house, in the northwest part of the town

plots: Ragefast enslaved the nymph
Ragefast locked the nymph inside Ragefast's house
title: The Captive Nymph
objective: investigate Ragefast and his nymph
description:
You may call me Lady Hannah. Ragefast! Oh, he makes me seethe! He's a mage on a power trip and what does he do?
He acquires his own personal nymph and enslaves her in his quarters! Seek him out and look into this matter immediately! His house is in the northwest part of town.
I wish you luck and all the passion of my fury in your task.

plots: Roderick lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine
title: Bad Medicine
objective: assassinate Roderick without been seen by his company of loyal mercenaries
tasks: replace Roderick's medicine with a poisoned bottle Ocheeva gives you
description:
Far to the west there lives a fierce warlord and his company of loyal mercenaries. Your target is the warlord. Do you accept this contract?
Now listen closely. Nestled in the mountains to the west lies Fort Sutch. It is the home of the warlord Roderick and his mercenaries. Roderick has recently taken ill. He now lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine.
You must infiltrate Fort Sutch, find Roderick's medicine, and replace it with a poisoned bottle I will provide. But you must remain undetected! Whomever arranged this contract wants it to look like Roderick died from his illness, so discretion is essential. Attack no one! Be seen by no one! If you are detected, the poisoning will fail, and Roderick must be killed in some other manner. That will, of course, forfeit your bonus.
Roderick may lie near death, but dead he is not. Until his soul has passed, our client -- and the Grim Reaper himself -- will not be satisfied.

plots: just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers: it has recently been tightly locked, but Vicente Valtieri will provide a key
title: Scheduled for Execution
objective: assassinate Valen Dreth in the Imperial Prison
tasks: infiltrate the Imperial Prison via a set of secret tunnels
description:
Back for more? It just so happens I have another contract available, one that requires an expert in infiltration.
Ever broken out of jail? How do you feel about breaking into one? The Imperial Prison, to be exact. We need a prisoner... silenced. Can you do it?
Your target is a Dark Elf named Valen Dreth. He thinks he's safe in prison. He is tragically mistaken. A prisoner recently escaped from the prison, using a set of secret tunnels connecting to the Imperial City's sewer system. It's a perfect way inside. Just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers. It has recently been tightly locked, but I will provide a key. It should be easy enough to locate Dreth in his small cell. Besides, I think you know the way, hmmm. He he he he he.
Valen Dreth has been imprisoned for many years. His tongue is sharp, but his body is limp and frail. He will prove an easy, pleasurable kill. You will receive a bonus if you fulfill the contract without killing any of the prison guards. Now go, and may the Night Mother go with you.

plots: NONE
title: Workplace Enjoyment
objective: convince Mulush treat his workers better
description:
Mulush is a damn tyrant. Always being goaded on by the Silver-Bloods to get more work out of us.
They pay us next to nothing. We get beaten if we make a mistake, and where are our kind Silver-Blood rulers? What are they doing? Typical.
You would stick up for us. You're going to try to talk sense into that man? I'll believe it when I see it.
It's a week's wages for me, but you've earned every coin if you talk some sense into Mulush.

plots: Ragefast imprisoned Ragefast's nymph in Ragefast's house
title: A Nymph for Ramazith
objective: free Ragefast's nymph and bring her to Ramazith
description:
Greetings to you and yours, my friend. I'm Ramazith.
Might I have your ear a moment? My proposition is thus: I would have you enter into the home of a colleague of mine and effect the release of a creature he has imprisoned there. Ragefast be his name, and he has in his possession one of the most beautiful and useful creatures in all of Faerûn. It's a nymph he captured some time ago, and I know not what laughable plans he has for her, but I am sure she be more... productive in my care.
I not so rich as to be able to offer huge gold, but as competent wizard I do have the odd magical item of worth. Perhaps an enchanted item will serve your needs, no?

plots: NONE
title: Hunt the Hunter
objective: assassinate Anoriath
description:
There's Anoriath, a Wood Elf, who owns a market stall in the city of Whiterun.
He may run a stall in the city, but he retreats to the plains outside Whiterun to hunt. Kill him there, and no one will bear witness...
The hunter shall come to know the fear of the hunted, hmm? And I shall have your payment waiting for you, my friend.

plots: Baker wants comfort
the player is a friend of Baker
title: Is Today Someone's Birthday?
objective: bring a cake to Baker
description:
My friend, as you might know, I'm not a man to say no to the sweeter temptations in life.
I'd be overjoyed, if you baked me a delicious cake and brought it to me.
I'm not leaving you hanging either: I have 3 golden apples for you.

plots: Sheogorath does not know how much time he has left: Sheogorath wants the Gatekeeper to guard the Gates and be ready for Jyggalag's forces
the player should tell Relmyna that they are working for Sheogorath: Relmyna would do anything for Sheogorath
title: Rebuilding the Gatekeeper
objective: rebuild the Gatekeeper
description:
Things are getting a bit thin. Get that Gatekeeper in place, and do it quickly. I'm not sure how much time I have left.
It's essential. Simply essential! If only it were essentially simple... but it's not. I want him there guarding those Gates. If any of Jyggalag's forces show up, he should be ready for them.
It wouldn't do to just let them in if more show up. And more always show up. Still and all, I think things are going well, considering! Go talk to Relmyna in Xaselm. Tell her you're working for me. She'd do anything for me, that little minx.

plots: the player asked more work from Igmund
Igmund's father tried to negotiate with the Forsworn: they took his shield to Hagravens
title: A Shield for Igmund
objective: retrieve the shield for Igmund
tasks: get Igmund's father's shield back from Hagravens
description:
I do have more work for you. A personal matter. My father died trying to negotiate with the Forsworn, back when that was possible.
They took his shield to Hag's End, to those Hagraven beasts they consort with. I need you to bring it home where it belongs. I warn you, it's dangerous work. No man of mine has ever faced a Hagraven and lived. I'll understand if you decline.
Return my father's shield to me and I'll grant you permission to purchase property in my city.
Divines watch over you.

plots: Farkas will answer the player's questions about the Companions
title: Proving Honor
objective: complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
tasks: claim another fragment of Wuuthrad with Farkas
description:
We have something special for you this time.
Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out in Dustman's Cairn.
This is a simple errand, but the time is right for it to be your Trial. Carry yourself with honor, and you'll become a true Companion. Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp. He'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get Farkas killed.

plots: Cindiri Arano sent the Folio to the First Edition to be rebound: they sent it back on the Strident Squall
title: First Edition
objective: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
description:
A few months ago, I had sent an important Folio to the First Edition to be rebound. They sent it back to me recently, but it never arrived.
The Folio was aboard the "Strident Squall" or something like that. The damn thing sunk right off the coast of Solstheim. Can you imagine? One of the sailors survived. Poor thing crawled all the way to Raven Rock on his hands and knees. Before he died, he told the guard about the wreck and warned us that it was going to be crawling with reavers.
Could you find the Folio for me? You have no idea how much it hurts losing such a precious item!

plots: the player has stolen something from their fellow Fighters Guild members: this is the player's first offense
title: Expelled from the Fighters Guild
objective: bring 20 bear pelts to Vilena Donton
description:
You would steal from your brothers? If you had a need for something, why would you not just ask?
I will give you a chance, though. As it is only your first offense, do not return until you have collected 20 bear pelts.
Use this time to reflect on your actions.

TESO339: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks

plots: the Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis against Adamus Phillida
title: Permanent Retirement
objective: assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
description:
I have another assassination contract for you.
Do you recall the name Adamus Phillida? The Imperial Legion pest? It's time he joined Death in the Void. Think you're up to the task?
Adamus Phillida has spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, interrupting our contracts, killing our family members! We tried to eliminate Phillida, of course, but failed on three separate occasions. He's a powerful man, and was surrounded by powerful associates. Now the Legion's pig's years of service have come to an end. He has retired. Phillida must not be allowed such a victory! His destiny is... darker. Phillida now resides in Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks, an honored guest of the soldiers there. He is, in fact, more vulnerable than ever.
The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis. It is a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target. In this case, Phillida. As long as the arrow hits Phillida, he will die. But it cannot pierce armor! Shoot while Phillida is armored, and the Rose will be wasted. Travel to Leyawiin. Track Phillida. Learn his schedule. Observe when he removes that blasted Legion armor! And then, let fly the Rose of Sithis! Kill Phillida in any way, Rose or not, and the contract is complete. But to receive a bonus, you must go beyond murder. You must send a message! Once Phillida is dead, take the very finger from his corpse, the one that bears an Imperial Legion signet ring! Deposit this finger in the desk of Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City! Do this, and the bonus is yours.

BG1188: the pirate cove along the coast, south of Candlekeep
BG1189: the pirate cove along the coast, south of Candlekeep

plots: Safana will join the player
Safana has a map that shows the location of Black Alaric's treasure
title: Safana's Treasure Hunt
objective: get Black Alaric's treasure for yourself and Safana
tasks: find Black Alaric's treasure with Safana
description:
My name is Safana and I can make you richer than you could imagine.
I know where the pirate Black Alaric dumped his greatest trove of treasure. Knowing that you are a dynamic and intelligent person, I know you'd want to join me in a venture to get this treasure.
Well, we should be off then. From what my map showed, the pirate cove is located somewhere along the coast, just south of Candlekeep.

plots: the player asked Calcelmo to let the player inside his Dwemer museum: the Dwemer museum is a private place where Calcelmo can catalog his research
title: Nimhe, the Poisoned One
objective: kill Nimhe
description:
You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?

plots: Bob wants reputation
NONE
title: Coming Soon!
objective: promote the services of Bob in nearby villages
tasks: hand out promotional items to villagers
description:
Hail! It's rare to see another traveler out in the wilderness. I'm a wandering merchant by trade: I travel from village to village to sell my merchandise.
You wouldn't mind helping me out a bit in exchange for an enchanted book? I'd like you to promote my services in nearby villages: Seaside Settlement, Desert Refuge, and Stoneburg.
I am already fairly well-known in the coastal Seaside Settlement, so you just gotta tell the villagers there that I am coming there soon. For the villagers of Desert Refuge out in the desert, I have some promotional items that I want you to hand out. Lastly, I want you to give some coupons to the villagers of the mountainous Stoneburg.
Good luck in your promotional mission!

plots: NONE
title: Noralee's Gauntlets
objective: bring Noralee's gauntlets to her
tasks: find Noralee's gauntlets inside a shipping crate
description:
I'm Noralee.
I just had some new armor shipped in from a far-away city and I'm afraid I must have dropped the gauntlets into one of the shipping crates somewhere between here and the harbor.
Please, if you can find them before somebody else picks them up, I would be most grateful.

plots: the player asked Marise Aravel how she keeps the food she sells so fresh
title: Ice Cold
objective: bring five ice wraith teeth to Marise Aravel
description:
I picked up a trick from a master butcher. He showed me a way to grind up ice wraith teeth and use it as a preservative. Keeps everything cold and fresh, but only for a limited time.
I'm always looking to replenish my supply, so if you ever come across five of them, I'd be more than happy to take them off your hands. The last traveler that traded me some said he found them at a place called Ancient's Ascent.
Careful though, rumor has it a dragon makes its home there.

plots: Herbert wants knowledge
NONE
title: Mushroom Mania
objective: grow a huge mushroom, and report back to Herbert
tasks: find a way to grow a regular mushroom to a huge mushroom
description:
Mushrooms are awesome! I love everything about them! Their texture, their taste...
Some travelers claim to have seen some huge, giant mushrooms that stand as tall as trees. I want to see one for real!
Could you help me see a huge mushroom? You are a traveler: you must know how to grow huge mushrooms. Please find a regular mushroom from a place shielded from direct sunlight, and find a way to grow it into a huge mushroom somewhere where I can see it.
Report back to me after growing a huge mushroom, and I'll reward you with a bunch of golden carrots. They are tasty, but I prefer mushrooms. Especially steamy, hot mushroom stew that waters one's mouth.

plots: Julienne Fanis can tell the player more about Garridan's Tears
title: Tears of the Savior
objective: find as many Garridan's Tears for S'Drassa as possible
description:
S'Drassa of the Mages Guild. Evoker and Alchemist. Could you assist me in acquiring something for my crystal collection?
I'm searching for some specific crystals known as Garridan's Tears. I want you to bring me as many of Garridan's Tears as you can find. If you do, I will pay you a fair bounty in gold for each one. I confess I have a weakness for crystals of a magical nature, and I must add these to my collection. This is a personal errand, you must understand. Just between you and I. The Mages Guild has nothing to do with it.
The Tears are not just a namesake. They're literally the frozen tears of a knight named Garridan Stalrous who lived many years ago. I'm not certain what happened to the knight, or why the tears were frozen, but I do know someone you could ask. Seek out Julienne Fanis at the Arcane University in the Imperial City. She oversees the Alchemy Headquarters there. If anyone can help you get more information on about these crystals, she can.

plots: the player, a member of the Dark Brotherhood, came to see Amaund Motierre after he had performed the Black Sacrament
Amaund Motierre wants to arrange several assassination contracts with the Dark Brotherhood, leading to the assassination of the emperor
Amaund Motierre gives the player two items: a sealed letter that will explain everything that needs to be done, and a valuable amulet - the player can use it to pay for any and all expenses
title: The Silence Has Been Broken
objective: accept Amaund Motierre's assassination contract
tasks: take the sealed letter and the valuable amulet to your superior in the Dark Brotherhood
description:
By the almighty Divines. You've come. You've actually come. This dreadful Black Sacrament thing... it worked.
Well, I won't waste your time. I would like to arrange a contract. Several, actually. I daresay, the work I'm offering has more significance than anything your organization has experienced in, well, centuries.
As I said, I want you to kill several people. You'll find the targets, as well as their manners of elimination, quite varied. I'm sure someone of your disposition will probably even find it enjoyable. But you should know that these killings are but a means to an end. For they pave the way to the most important target. The real reason I'm speaking with a cutthroat in the bowels of this detestable crypt. For I seek the assassination of... ...the Emperor.
What I ask is no small thing, of course. But you represent the Dark Brotherhood. This is... what you do? No? You must understand. So much has led to this day. So much planning, and maneuvering. Now, it's as if the very stars have finally aligned. But I digress. Here, take these two items. They need to be delivered to your, um... superior. The sealed letter will explain everything that needs to be done. The amulet is quite valuable - you can use it to pay for any and all expenses.

plots: Sprocket traveled here from his home village to find Blue Boletus for his cousins who are afflicted with the Black Blindness
title: The Blue Boletus
objective: bring Blue Boletus flesh to Sprocket
description:
Oh, please - perhaps you can help us! On the advice of our village's healer, I have traveled here seeking a cure. My cousins are afflicted with the Black Blindness, an ailment peculiar to our race.
Black Blindness is an insidious disease - it dims the vision and makes speech impossible, and if not treated within a few weeks, can become permanent. The only known treatment is produced from the flesh of the Blue Boletus - a species of mushroom creatures that grows only in the Fungal Caves near here. I find that they are, ah, BIGGER than I had anticipated, however.
Perhaps YOU could retrieve some Blue Boletus flesh for us? We would be forever in your debt!

plots: Armand Christophe is addressing the player, Methredhel, and Amusei
members of the Thieves Guild are followers of the Gray Fox: the one who wins the contest is allowed to join the Thieves Guild
the beggars will help the player locate Amantius Allectus's diary, for a price
Armand Christophe can sell the player lockpicks
title: May the Best Thief Win
objective: win the contest against Methredhel and Amusei
tasks: steal Amantius Allectus's diary without killing him, Methredhel, or Amusei
description:
Everyone is here, let's begin.
Each of you is seeking membership in the Thieves Guild. The Thieves Guild is not a myth. We are followers of the Gray Fox, and I am his Doyen.
Merely by finding me, you have passed the first test. It's unusual for us to have three potential recruits at the same time. Rather than the normal test of skill, I'm going to make this a contest. Methredhel, you know the rules. However, for Amusei and the newcomer, let me state them clearly.
Whoever brings me the diary of Amantius Allectus, without killing him, will be invited into the guild. It's somewhere in the Imperial City. The beggars will help you locate it, for a price. I can sell you lockpicks if you need them.
One more thing. You cannot kill each other during this trial. We may be thieves, but we're not murderers.

plots: the player is meeting Paarthurnax for the first time: the player is the Dovahkiin
title: The Throat of the World
objective: receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
tasks: hear Paarthurnax's shout, and match it with your own
description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Paarthurnax. Who are you? What brings you to my mountain? Forgive me. I gave in to the temptation to prolong our speech. I know you are Dovahkiin.
You have come here to learn from me. Patience. There are formalities that must be observed, at the first meeting of two of the dragons. By long tradition, the elder speaks first. Hear my shout! Feel it in your bones.
Match it, if you are Dovahkiin!

TL269: the catacombs, where dark things live

plots: Jessa and her father came here to recover the Wraithring: they wanted to bring it to the Temple for study
Jessa's father wears a locket around his neck
title: The Wraithring
objective: discover Jessa's father's fate
description:
Please, traveler! Wait a moment! I am Jessa - a traveler from Estheria. My father and I came to this place to recover an ancient artifact - the Wraithring - which is said to have power over death itself. We sought to bring it to the Temple for study.
My father entered the catacombs while I tended our camp - but he has not returned, and there are dark things stirring below.
Please - I only ask that you discover his fate - perhaps he is wounded and only needs aid to escape!
If the worst comes to pass... he wears a locket around his neck, and you will know him by it.

plots: Yago has cursed Namara: Brielbara can undo the curse with Yago's spellbook
title: Brielbara's Baby
objective: bring Yago's spellbook to Brielbara
description:
Travelers! I am Brielbara, a mage of minor power.
I'll pay you 200 gold, not much for heroic adventurers, but all that I have.
An evil mage has laid a curse upon my only child, Namara. She is slowly wasting away and, without help, she'll die. The mage who did this is named Yago, and I'm sure that he possesses the remedy to the curse. Would you track him down for me, please? He's been staying at a place called the Low Lantern. It's the playground for the wicked and depraved, a ship where prostitutes ply their trade. All I want you to do is find him and take his spellbook. I have enough magical skill to reverse the curse if I had the formula for his spell.

BG2106: in the north side of this chamber
BG2107: in the north side of this chamber

plots: Aerie works in the circus with Quayle
there's an illusion that makes Aerie look like a monster
Aerie has been chained: the key to her chains looks like a sword
the commoners have the key
Aerie regains her normal form after becoming free
title: Set Aerie Free
objective: free Aerie
tasks: get the key to Aerie's chains from commoners
description:
M-my name is Aerie. I... work in the circus with my uncle, Quayle... I... I'm not a monster! I'm an elf, a winged elf... or at least I was... This... this covering you see is some kind of illusion, but if you believe in it, then it becomes real! P-please believe me! Now go before something happens to you, I beg of you!
If... if you're not going to flee, then maybe you can help free me from the chains that keep me bound in this form — and then maybe I can help you!
You... you need the key to these chains. But... but it won't look like a key! There are a couple of... commoners... in the north side of this chamber...
Don't be fooled by the illusion, though... they are monsters! They have a sword which is actually my key... if you get it from them, I can remove the chain and regain my normal form!
But please be careful! You... you can't trust anything you see here!

plots: Oliver wants knowledge
Oliver has heard that the player help people
title: Misguided Arrows
objective: collect what a creeper drops upon death after being killed by a skeleton, and report to Oliver
tasks: make a skeleton kill a creeper
description:
I've been pondering about something. Village legends tell that creepers drop something very peculiar when killed by skeletons.
I have heard that you are a helpful person. Could you perhaps collect that item and report back to me? You just have to figure out how to get a skeleton kill a creeper.
This might be a difficult task to accomplish. You will be rewarded accordingly: five blocks of diamond. Surely you too are curious about what happens.

plots: Arkion and Nemphre used to be lovers
Arkion wants Nemphre's Onyx Ring
Nemphre wants Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet
title: Arkion and Nemphre
objective: steal Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring, and bring them to Ordulinian
tasks: find Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring
description:
Ah, fair adventurers, I'm Ordulinian.
The roads of this fair city are lined with fools, are they not? Two of the greatest are Arkion and Nemphre, necromancers grown bitter over lost love. Alas, but they use petty trinkets as their excuse for enmity. Nemphre covets Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Arkion dreams of her Onyx Ring. Steal those trinkets and bring them to me and perhaps those two fools can at last find peace.
For your troubles I will give you a Cloak of Non-Detection. It may be of some use to you in the future.

plots: the player told Maramal that the player wants to get married
these are difficult times
title: The Bonds of Matrimony
objective: get married
tasks: attend your wedding tomorrow, from dawn until dusk
description:
Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples.
You wish to be married to your future spouse? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times. Your wedding will be held tomorrow, from dawn until dusk, in the Temple of Mara.

plots: NONE
title: Raid on Greyland
objective: bring Kylius Lonavo's ring as the proof of his death to Lerexus Callidus
tasks: kill Kylius Lonavo and his group of Skooma dealers
description:
Hmmm. Perhaps you'll be able to assist me. I'm after some Skooma dealers.
A small group of Skooma dealers led by a Dunmer named Kylius Lonavo is holed up in the Greyland house just up the road. I've been trying to catch Lonavo for months, but every time I approach the place, his lookout sees me and he goes running. I need someone to go in there and put a stop to those fetchers. I don't care what it takes. We must get that poison they're selling off the street.
Bring me Lonavo's ring as proof he's... been dealt with... and I'll give you the bounty on him. Be vigilant. Lonavo is a snake.

plots: when Brand-Shei was found by his Argonian father, Brand-Shei was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni
title: Distant Memories
objective: help Brand-Shei uncover his past
description:
I may be dark elf by birth, but I was raised Argonian. Through reasons I'm still trying to discover, I ended up orphaned then taken in by a kindly Argonian family in Black Marsh. I hope one day to find out what happened to me... how I ended up like that.
I know when I was found by my Argonian father, I was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni. It was one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago. Whether that means I was one of them or not, I'm uncertain.
If you come across anything in your travels that might provide me with the answers I'm looking for, I'd be grateful.

BG1292: northeast of the village, in the woods
BG1293: northeast of the village, in the woods

plots: Maralee's husband took Peladan hunting: werewolves attacked Peladan and his father
Peladan went missing, but Maralee's husband was killed
Peladan and Maralee's husband have dark hair
title: Maralee's Child
objective: return Peladan to Maralee
description:
Hello, good people. I am Maralee. Two moons ago my husband took my son out hunting with him. They were attacked by those horrible wolf-creatures. They... they killed my husband and took my baby.
Others say that they took the baby away to eat him, but I know he's still alive. He's a beautiful little boy with dark hair like his father. He is three moons old and his name is Peladan.
They took him from my husband northeast of the village, in the woods.

TESO140: the many military fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil
TESO142: the many military fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil

plots: NONE
title: A Venerable Vintage
objective: bring the Shadowbanish Wine to Nerussa
description:
Greetings. I'm Nerussa. I'm quite fond of collecting all manners of wines from all over Tamriel. But one vintage continues to elude me: Shadowbanish Wine. How I'd love to add it to my collection.
Apparently the wine is so rare because it was only made in one tiny batch. It's the product of an alchemist who was also a vintner. Besides tasting incredible, the magic within the wine allows the imbiber to be gifted with Night Eye! The vintner made it special for the Legion soldiers posted at the forts when they were active long ago. It was perfect for keeping lookouts warm on cold nights and helping them see better in the dark.
If you can retrieve six bottles of Shadowbanish Wine, I'll gladly pay you well: 1,000 gold. All I know about them is that they're found in the many fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil.

plots: Jack wants knowledge
NONE
title: Bowing Down Creepers
objective: test out the Awesome Bow, and report back to Jack
tasks: kill 15 Creepers with the Awesome Bow
description:
I'm a fletcher. Bows and arrows are my domain.
In fact, I've just crafted a special Bow I've dubbed the "Awesome Bow". I just need someone to test it out.
You could be just the right person for the job. Go, and kill 15 Creepers with the Awesome Bow. I friggin' hate those green suicide bombing monsters! I'll have 32 emeralds for you, as a tester's fee.

plots: Martin wants reputation
NONE
title: Sweets for All
objective: give 10 honey blocks to Martin
description:
I'd like to bake my delicious honey cakes for the whole village! Then they'd certainly know that I have traveled all over the world! I even used to be a wandering trader.
I need a lot of honey for the cakes. You are quite a wanderer yourself. Perhaps you could help me procure 10 honey blocks. You can get honey from bees; you just have to find them first.
Do this for me, and I'll give you a special reward: a Shulker Box. These things were worth their weight in emeralds every time someone murdered my pack llamas: they made hauling my stock much easier.

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one Demented and other Manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there is a law about that and the Hill of Suicides is not a nice place
title: A Serious Split
objective: resolve the issue with duplicate citizens
tasks: kill the manic citizens of Split
description:
Talking wears me, Horkvir Bear-Arm, out.
My double is always working. It takes all my energy just watching him work. It's got to stop. It's a problem, all these doubles walking around. And it's tiresome. Didn't used to be like this.
Some blasted mage. Had a theory. They've always got theories. He thought there was a Manic and a Demented in each of us. So, what does he do? What else? Casts a spell. You can see how well that went. Two of each of us walking around this place. Nothing we can do about it, either. There's a law about that here. Been to the Hill of Suicides? Not a nice place. But you might be able to help.
Only one group can stick around. Either we Demented or those blasted Manics. It's the only way we'll find any peace. You get rid of those Manics. All of them. If you can take care of that for me, I'd make it worth your while..

plots: Trill is known throughout Veras: from Torchlight to Redhaven
title: The Three Sisters
objective: find the 3 sisters
tasks: investigate a tree trunk in an area full of spiders
description:
Greetings! I am the great bard Trill. You've heard of me of course, my talent is known throughout all of Veras. From Torchlight to Redhaven they sing of my.. songs.
Torchlight... did something happen there? I feel a bit... Ah, nevermind. I recognize this place!
The spiders called, the Sisters three, the old trunk yawning wide,
Through ancient halls, dark ancestry, they met their fates inside.
An apt verse, you'll agree. I wrote it myself of course.
The rest of the song eludes me... Leniency please! Of course such a lapse is unforgivable in a great bard such as myself, but I feel a bit.. off.
Still, even that bare fragment of verse can lead you to glory. Go forth, brave warrior, and slay the mighty beasts! Whatever they may be...

plots: Martin has made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual while the player was gone
the player may have seen lesser Welkynd Stones: they are common in Ayleid ruins
title: Miscarcand
objective: recover a Great Welkynd Stone for Martin
description:
While you were gone, I've made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual.
The third item we need is a Great Welkynd Stone. You may have run across lesser Welkynd Stones; they are fairly common in Ayleid ruins. But a Great Welkynd Stone will not be easy to come by. They have been plundered one by one over the years, due to their great value to mages and occultists.
There is only one place that is rumored to still contain one: the ruins of the Ayleid city of Miscarcand. A place where many have perished seeking its Great Welkynd Stone. But nothing else will do, so you must succeed where all others have failed.

plots: Tolgerias seeks to employ the player in a matter of some urgency: Madeen has been given little knowledge of the matter
title: Tolgerias' Task
objective: find out what Tolgerias wants you to do
description:
Greetings. I am Madeen. I represent one of the masters of the Athkatla order of the Cowled Wizards. He seeks to employ you in a matter of some urgency.
The matter is most sensitive... I have been given little knowledge of it. Tolgerias, the one whom I speak for, is eager to meet with you and discuss these matters.
Master Tolgerias can be found in the government building behind me... you may go within. Do not tarry overlong, my friend.

plots: ankheg armor is comparable to full plate with half the weight
there is an iron shortage
title: An Offer from Taerom
objective: sell your ankheg shells
tasks: give your ankheg shells to Taerom Fuiruim
description:
Hello there, I'm Taerom Fuiruim, a blacksmith of some renown.
An interesting piece o' material you got there. Ankheg, if I'm not mistaken. Been a while since I seen the like, but if I remember correctly, it makes a fine set of armor. If properly treated it's comparable to full plate with half the weight!
If you're willing to part with your shells I'll give you 500 gold for the lot of them. No more can I offer with business as slow as it is.
Iron shortage hurting us all.

plots: Dervenin's master says that Dervenin is interrupting his vacation
without Dervenin's master's guidance, Dervenin's homeland is falling apart
Dervenin's master went into the Pelagius Wing to talk with an old friend
Dervenin gives the player a hip bone: the player can't enter Pelagius Wing without it
title: The Mind of Madness
objective: gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
tasks: talk to Una or Erdi about entering the Pelagius Wing
description:
My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind. Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against the south! We need his return. Oh, but... I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the local ruler. No, no... such people are below him. No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea. Oh and you'll need the hip bone... it's very important. No entering Pelagius Wing without that.
The doors to the Pelagius Wing are locked. But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?

plots: Umbra the Sword contains the soul of Umbra the Hero
title: Clavicus Vile's Lost Sword
objective: retrieve Umbra the Sword for Clavicus Vile
tasks: begin your search for Umbra the Sword
description:
A mortal! Wonderful. Always a pleasure. I'm Clavicus Vile, the Prince of Trickery and Bargains.
Perhaps you'll do a service for me, mortal. And I'll reward you. A fair bargain, don't you think? You will retrieve for me a sword, a very special sword. It contains the soul of Umbra the Hero, a hero I have had dealings with in the past.
Bring the sword to me, and I'll reward you with my Masque. You'll not find a better bargain, mortal. Begin your search in Pell's Gate.

plots: NONE
title: Palin and the Monsters
objective: save people from monsters
description:
Good day to you, stranger. I'm called Palin. Excuse my, uhm, abruptness but I would ask your assistance.
Just east of this place there are monsters. They are attacking a small group of people. Please, if you have hearts, come and help me fight.

plots: Harry wants comfort
the player is an infamous person
the player can craft a piston with 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and Redstone Dust
title: Brain Over Brawl
objective: give 10 pistons to Harry
description:
You are the person who's been causing trouble in these parts, aren't you?
Why don't we put your energy to a better use? I'm a mason, which means that I have to move large quantities of stone from one place to another. I'd like to automate that process with pistons. That would save me from backache.
The problem is I don't have the materials for making pistons, or the know-how to craft them. This is where you enter the picture. Craft 10 pistons, and then bring them to me. I know that you need 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and Redstone Dust for crafting a piston.
Some quarts pillars broke while we were transporting them. You could have the remaining 32 Nether Quartz from them.

MC34: deserts, taiga forests, and frozen regions
MC35: deserts, taiga forests, and frozen regions

plots: Wilson wants comfort
the player is an enemy of Wilson
title: It's Your Lucky Day
objective: bring a rabbit's foot to Wilson
description:
Oh. It's you. As if I wouldn't have enough to worry about...
Or perhaps even a devil like you has a heart. Would you help me sweep my worries away by bringing me a rabbit's foot? I'd like to feel luckier. Hunt down a rabbit. They are found in deserts, taiga forests, and frozen regions. Rabbits are quite quick on their feet, so they might keep you busy for a while.
