Do this for me, and I'll give you a Potion of Leaping. That should help you jump out of my sight faster.

plots: the player and Ralof are making their escape together: the player is a Nord
title: Unbound
objective: escape Imperial custody with Ralof
tasks: jump through the roof of the inn on the other side and keep running
description:
Hey, Nord. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! I'll follow when I can!

plots: NONE
title: The Spiced Wine
objective: convince the East Empire Company to release Evette San's shipment of spices, and return back to Evette San for your reward
tasks: talk to Vittoria Vici about Evette San's shipment of spices
description:
Hello! I'm the spiced wine merchant Evette San. You wouldn't have a few minutes to run down to the docks would you?
I've got a shipment of spices the East Empire Company is holding up. I need someone to convince them to release it. The person handling shipments is called Vittoria Vici. You should try to talk to her about my shipment.
Get back to me when you're done and I'll give you something for your time. I swear it's a fight with them every shipment.

plots: the note is addressed toward the player: the player is the Silence of the Dark Brotherhood
the player assassinated Shaleez for Lucien Lachance
Alval Uvani is renting a house in Leyawiin
Alval Uvani's wife hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill her husband: the Morag Tong of Morrowind can't reach Alval Uvani in Cyrodiil
Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dunmer condition, a serious allergy to honey: he would suffer from complete paralyzation after drinking honey-based mead
title: A Matter of Honor
objective: assassinate Alval Uvani
tasks: locate Alval Uvani with a schedule included in this dead drop
description:
Dead Drop Orders #5
by Lucien Lachance

If you're reading this note, Shaleez is dead. You've done the world a great service, Silencer. It's time to continue the good work.
Your next target is a traveling Dark Elf merchant by the name of Alval Uvani, who is currently renting a house in the city of Leyawiin. Uvani is a well-respected tradesman back in his native Morrowind, but his business often takes him very far from home. Therein lies the problem. Alval Uvani's wife has become disillusioned with her husband's repeated, extended absences and wishes to dissolve their marriage, and has sought the Dark Brotherhood's assistance. Lucky for us Cyrodiil is a bit beyond the reach of Morrowind's Morag Tong.
Alval Uvani is currently traveling around Cyrodiil, and is never in one place for more than a couple of days. In this dead drop you will also find a schedule detailing the Dark Elf's whereabouts; use it to locate him and plan your elimination. Be aware, however, that because he is forced to travel alone to the farthest reaches of the Empire, Uvani has learned to defend himself. He is a master of the Destruction school of Magicka, and is no stranger to killing.
When Alval Uvani lies rotting, journey to the Market District of the Imperial City. There you will find a shop called Stonewall Shields. Your dead drop is located behind that building, in a hollowed-out tree stump. As usual, you will find your reward for the previous contract, as well as information on your next.
Ah yes, I must mention one last detail. Apparently Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dark Elf condition, a serious allergy to honey. If you could somehow get Uvani to drink the honey-based mead, perhaps by replacing his food, he would suffer from complete paralyzation. This would certainly make the Dark Elf a bit easier to deal with.

plots: NONE
title: Hunt and Gather
objective: retrieve Wylandriah's Dwemer Spoon, Orichalcum Ingot, and Grand Soul Gem
description:
I could use some help with getting organized. An assistant perhaps? No, no, no. Maybe a familiar. No, too messy. Well, at any rate, organization is not my strong suit. Not at all. I need as much help as I can get.
In fact, if you could retrieve a few things for me, I could start on my next set of experiments. What I need is my Dwemer Spoon, my Orichalcum Ingot and my Grand Soul Gem. In fact, I could use them immediately.
Well... why are you still standing here? Oh, right. You need to know where they are! That would help. Let's see. Last time I used the Dwemer Spoon was at my dear friend Boti's house in Ivarstead... Fellstar Farm I believe it's called. The Orichalcum Ingot should still be in Winterhold at the Frozen Hearth Inn. I don't know why I didn't just take it with me. And last is the gem. I left that one in Windhelm at the White Phial alchemy shop. It was a good trade too. Ah well.
Bring those items back to me and I'll be happy to experiment on you. No, no... that isn't right. I'd be happy to reward you.

plots: NONE
title: White Wolf Pelts
objective: bring a white wolf's pelt to the merchant
description:
I am but a humble merchant. Interested in a little business on the side, friend?
I've a man who swears by his grandmother he glimpsed a white wolf up in the Cloudpeak ice fields. It was but a short ways south, and she be easy pickings for a smart sword.
I'd pay you good money for its pelt, so it's a guaranteed sale if you go.
Keep it in mind on your travels.

plots: Aldeth Sashenstar has been holed up in a cabin for several days
the savages threatened Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends to stop hunting
the savages killed Elban
title: Aldeth and the Group of Savages
objective: protect Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends from a group of savages
tasks: prepare for the savages' attack on Aldeth Sashenstar's cottage
description:
I am Aldeth Sashenstar. You must understand that at the moment, I'm under a terrible amount of stress.
You see, my dear friend, there is a group of uncouth savages that has declared their intention of killing my friends and me. I've been holed up in this cabin for several days and have lacked the wherewithal to try to make an escape.
My friends and I come here every year to do some sport hunting. This year however, a group of woodland savages threatened us with bodily harm if we did not stop our hunting trip. Being civilized men, we realized that it's well within our rights to hunt where we damn well please. After a few more days of hunting, the crass woodmen lost all pretense of humanity and murdered Elban, one of my oldest friends.
I'm sure that they plan to attack our cottage here, so we had best be prepared.

plots: Jorundr and Arnora Auria have had a rocky relationship: Jorundr and Arnora Auria committed petty crimes all over Cyrodiil
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets
Arnora Auria got afraid of Jorundr

Jorundr and Arnora Auria's last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City: Jorundr killed a guard and he was captured by the Bruma guard two days later at Jorundr and Arnora Auria's makeshift campsite
Jorundr had moved the stolen gold away from the campsite
title: Two Sides of the Coin
objective: find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
description:
Here's the deal. Jorundr and I have had a rocky relationship at best.
Against my will, I've been dragged all over Cyrodiil helping him commit petty crimes. I wouldn't say we're thieves. I mean, we've stolen things... sure. But we've never stolen that much at one time. Just enough to keep us going. That is, until last year.
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Not just lone merchants, mind you. I'm talking about the bigger scores. Like estates and tax shipments. I begged him to stop, as I knew that his capers would one day lead to violence. He just threatened to... hurt me if I got in his way. I think the gold changed him. I really do. He wasn't the man I met seven years ago. The few times I tried to say something, he'd strike me or push me away. I began to become frightened of him.
Our last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City. We robbed it, and in the midst of the chaos, Jorundr killed a guard. I was mortified. We snatched up the gold and holed up in the mountains. He said if I breathed a word of the murder to anyone, he'd kill me. I was terrified of him at this point. Two days later, the Bruma City Guard traced us to our makeshift campsite. I was off gathering food, but Jorundr was captured. Served him right. When I went back to the site later, the gold was gone! He'd moved it! What I need you to do is go to the Bruma Castle Dungeons and speak to him for me. Convince him to tell you where the gold is and then we split it.

plots: Zed wants knowledge
NONE
title: Ancient Artisanship
objective: bring an ancient device to Zed
description:
Hello traveler. What brings you to Desert Refuge, this piece of civilization out in the scorching desert? Are you stocking up on supplies on your way to explore desert ruins?
If you are, I would like your help. I promise to pay you with something useful. The thing is, there's this ancient pyramid, Tut's Temple, a short way away from this village. It is said to be full of treasure! And some highly lethal traps that are too much to overcome for a meager researcher like me. There are also rumors that say that the ancients had useful devices lost to time. I'd love to get my hands on one, for science.
Please, go to Tut's Temple and find an ancient device! It may tell us about many lost crafts!

plots: the player summoned Sheogorath
Sheogorath wants to make Border Watch an interesting place
the people of Border Watch are superstitious
title: Entertaining Sheogorath
objective: find a way to make the first two parts of the K'Sharra come true
tasks: ask about the K'Sharra from the shaman
description:
Another mortal dares to summon me, Sheogorath, and already I am bored. But enough about me. Let's talk about you.
I could turn you into a goat. Or a puddle. Or a bad idea. I could make you eat your own fingers. Or fall in love with a cloud. Perhaps I could make you into something useful. Let's find out.
There's a little settlement called Border Watch. It's a nice, peaceful place... and dull, dull, dull. You're going to make their lives interesting. They're a superstitious bunch. Everything is an omen or a portent. Let's make one come true. Find their shaman and ask about the K'Sharra prophecy. You are to find a way to make the first two parts of the prophecy come true. I'll take care of the rest, because it's the most fun. Now, run along.

plots: NONE
title: Brithaur the Thief
objective: stop Brithaur from stealing from the shopkeepers of Crucible
description:
Brithaur's a thorn in my side that never seems to go away!
I'd have his heart on a plate if I could! I wish he'd simply disappear from the streets of New Sheoth forever! Oh look, just talking about it has given me another gray hair!
Brithaur is a thief, but what irks me the most is that he's a BAD thief. Between my shop and a few others in Crucible, he's been caught stealing maybe a dozen times last month. Who has time for this sort of thing? I mean, at this rate, I'll grow old and die before he's out of our hair! I'll tell you what I tell anyone else who asks.
Get rid of him for me and I'll make it worth your while. Do hurry... time's wasting!

plots: the Clockwork Core can be restored with Ordrak's Heart
title: Into the Dark
objective: defeat the Alchemist and seize Ordrak's Heart before he destroys the Clockwork Core
tasks: overtake the Alchemist before he reaches the Clockwork Core
description:
You must overtake the Alchemist before he reaches the Clockwork Core. With the power of Ordrak's Heart, he could destroy the barrier between the worlds, which would mean the end of everything.
You must defeat the Alchemist and seize the Heart. He intends to use it for destruction, but, infused with the energy stolen from the Guardians, it now has the power to restore the Clockwork Core, and repair the damage to the barrier.

plots: vampires are becoming a larger threat
title: Dawnguard
objective: join the Dawnguard
tasks: speak with Isran about joining the Dawnguard
description:
I'm Durak of the Dawnguard.
We are vampire hunters. We search out and destroy those bloodsucking scum wherever we find them. We are looking for anyone willing to fight against the growing vampire menace.
Everybody says that they are not interested about joining, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires.
Want to sign up to the Dawnguard and kill vampires? Go talk to Isran, our leader, at Fort Dawnguard, southeast of Riften. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.

plots: the player asked Sinderion to train them
title: Alchemy Training
objective: bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
tasks: find a bottle of Tamika's, and Surilie Brothers vintages of year 399
description:
Training? Oh, I'm afraid that's not my area of expertise. I'm very focused on wines right now, you see.
Wonderful thing, wine. It's all about the balance. The flavor, the bouquet, the consistency... just wonderful. I'm sorry, what? Training... right. I'll make you a deal: you fetch me a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad, and I'll think about it.
Both vineyards, Tamika's and Surilie Brothers. Vintage 399. Oh, what a good year that was...

plots: the Bravil city watch is useless: they can't catch the 4 escaped prison fugitives
title: The Fugitives
objective: find 4 escaped prison fugitives that have been causing trouble near Bravil
tasks: ask people about the 4 escaped prison fugitives
description:
I've got something for you. Could be tough. There are some escaped fugitives for you to find, meat.
Some real hard cases got out of the Bravil prison. Been terrorizing the locals ever since. The Watch is useless, so we step in.
Apparently, there are three or four of them. Real nasty, from what I hear. You take care of them. Maybe you'll get lucky and they'll surrender.
The people of Bravil aren't talking, but you might try asking around, butter them up a bit.
Get to it.

plots: the Morningales have been murdered: Tyrianna survived her family
title: Tyrianna's Family
objective: escort Tyrianna to the building beside the temple in the docks and wait for Hurgis Baltezan to arrive
description:
I have a vital mission for you that must take precedence over all else.
We have received word of a great atrocity, one that must not be completed. There has been... murder is too weak a word. An entire family has been decimated. The Morningales have been a model of decency in this city, and their work in opposing the slave trade has earned them renown across the land. It also earned them many enemies. This past tenday has seen the family murdered in their homes, almost to the last. It would seem they were made examples of.
The time for justice will come, but what is important now is that someone survived, praise Helm. Tyrianna — she hid in a cellar while all others were executed. She must be protected until escorted from the city. Her survival will be a symbol to persevere in the fight against slavery, despite the ferocity of the enemy. You will go to a safe house we have set up, and you will make sure she remains secure. It is as secret as we could make it, though nothing is ever absolute.
In the morning, her godparent will arrive. He is from Baldur's Gate and will accept no other guards besides his own. You will see that she reaches his care. Go to the building beside the temple in the docks and await him. She should be safe in his care. Hurgis Baltezan is his name, and a more upright citizen you will not find. He earned the title "Hand of Torm" in his service to the god of duty.
The Order shall reward you with a suit of powerful armor for your good works.

plots: NONE
title: Feeding the Addiction
objective: convince Geldis to let Bralsa Drel drink at The Retching Netch
tasks: talk to Geldis about Bralsa Drel
description:
Doesn't everyone pity the hopeless? Look at me... I'm no better than a beggar.
I used to be a miner, a good one too. I made more gold digging up ore in a month than some people earn in a lifetime. When the mine dried up, I was lost. I have no other trade, so I spend my time drinking my fortune away at the Retching Netch... or I used to anyway.
That fetcher Geldis won't even allow me inside. Said I was bad for business. If I want to spend my last bag of coins getting drunk, that's my business. What does he care?
If you can get that stubborn mule to let me into the Netch, I'll make sure you get what's coming to you.

plots: the player is a noble: Bolumir would like to be the chaplain of the player's keep
Bolumir does not promise to stay long at the player's keep
title: The Priest of Tempus
objective: deal with Bolumir
tasks: decide whether to accept Bolumir's offer or not
description:
My name be Bolumir, priest of Tempus, the god of battles!
Hahr... it has been some time since I have rested my feet in any place, to tell the truth. I've been wandering for many a year now. The traveling does wear on me, to tell the truth. I've come to ask if you've a chapel that a priest of Tempus might set himself up in... bring the good Word to the folk of the area.
What do you say, eh? If my manner does not strike you as offensive, I would be glad to be chaplain of your wee keep here. I can help your people here much while I stay. But I do not promise to stay for long. Either you accept me or you don't, my liege... that is your choice, and I'll not begrudge it you.

plots: NONE
title: Falling Awake
objective: help Amiable Fanriene to have some sleep
tasks: find a safe place to sleep outside
description:
Hello... don't mind me... Amiable Fanriene. I'm a little tired. Can't sleep at home, you know. The walls. They aren't safe.
I need someplace to sleep. I have seen some people sleeping out on the street, but they huddle too close to the walls. I need someplace safe. I can't just sleep anywhere. There're walls and statues and all sorts of things that can fall on me. Can't have that. Nope. But... if you find me a good place to sleep, a safe place -- outside -- I'll reward you!
Remember, walk lightly, and always look up.

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #3" has been addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
J'Ghasta turned down the offer to marry a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter: the noble hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill J'Ghasta
J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the Bruma streets
title: Broken Vows
objective: assassinate J'Ghasta
description:
Dead Drop Orders #3
by Lucien Lachance

Are you ready to get your hands dirty, Silencer?
Your next target is a Khajiit nobleman by the name of J'Ghasta, who can be found at his home in the city of Bruma. J'Ghasta was recently offered the hand of a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter, but turned down the offer when he learned of the girl's rather negligible dowry. The girl's family is outraged, of course, and has hired the Dark Brotherhood to make J'Ghasta pay for his insolence.
Go to J'Ghasta's house in Bruma and end his miserable life. But be warned! The Khajiit is rich and bored, and spends most of his time honing his skills in unarmed combat. Any opponent who can kill with merely his hands is not to be trifled with, so tread carefully. Even worse, J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the city streets.
When the target has been eliminated, you will find your next dead drop in a rotten box under the Old Bridge, just south of the Imperial City. The box will contain your reward for killing J'Ghasta, as well as information regarding your next contract.

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner's father hid her dowry
title: Canceled Wedding
objective: find the hidden dowry for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's dowry from a hollowed-out tree stump
description:
You... you can't do this to me. Do you have any idea who I am? When my father hears about this, he will gut you.
Ah, now I understand. This is about my father's hidden cache, isn't it? The dowry for my wedding? Ha! Well it's safely hidden away, in a hollowed-out tree stump. Just outside Riften, tucked away nice and secure. You'll never find it.
Damn it. I gave it away, didn't I?

TESS733: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town
TESS734: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town

plots: the golden dragon claw was stolen from Lucan Valerius' shop
title: The Golden Claw
objective: retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius
description:
We did have a bit of a... break-in. But we still have plenty to sell. Robbers were only after one thing. An ornament, solid gold. In the shape of a dragon's claw.
I've got some coin coming in from my last shipment. It's yours if you bring my claw back. If you're going after those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.

plots: the player told Taarie that the player is going to the Blue Palace
title: Fit for a Jarl
objective: promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
tasks: wear one of the Radiant Raiment's outfits, and speak to Elisif about it
description:
You're really going to the Blue Palace? That presents an opportunity.
If you were willing to wear one of Radiant Raiment's outfits and speak to the Jarl I would not only pay you but let you keep the outfit.
Here's the outfit. Try to get Jarl Elisif's opinion on it and if she likes it mention it's from Radiant Raiment.

plots: NONE
title: A Political Murder
objective: assassinate Helvard
description:
You are going on a little vacation in Falkreath. You'll be able to enjoy the sights, sample the food... and kill the housecarl, Helvard.
You know what that means? He's the bodyguard to the Jarl of Falkreath himself. So be careful. That's sure to throw a branch into Falkreath's well-oiled political machine.

plots: magic is hated in Amn
Valygar Corthala has murdered two Cowled Wizards: he is currently in hiding
Valygar Corthala's friends and servants will not speak to Cowled Wizards
title: The Hunt for Valygar Corthala
objective: deliver Valygar Corthala to the Cowled Wizards dead or alive
description:
I am Tolgerias, a proud member of the Amnian Cowled Wizards.
This matter must be handled with discretion and expediency. There is something that has been plaguing us for more than a week now and has become quite alarming.
You know of the prevailing attitude against magic here in Amn, yes? Well, amongst some it is even worse than that... a burning, palpable hatred. One particular man here in Athkatla has murdered two of our number in cold blood. He is currently in hiding, and we need you to track the fellow down. We have been unable to do so, much to our frustration. Cowled Wizards cannot be assaulted without repercussions or it will lead to... serious problems.
He is Valygar Corthala, last son of a wealthy family and a true brute. Ask around and you may discover if he is hiding within the city or someplace else. He has a home here in the Docks District, or he may have fled to the Umar Hills. His friends and servants will not speak to us, but they may to you.
We do not ask that you commit any murder. We wish Valygar be delivered to us, that is all. He will likely resist, so if you must kill him, so be it. But if you do kill him, I simply must have his body. Valygar must be delivered to us whether he is dead or alive. You understand, yes?

plots: Bella wants comfort
the player can craft golden apples by combining an apple with gold ingots
title: Fine Dining
objective: bring 5 golden apples to Bella
description:
I'm sick and tired of eating the same boring, mundane food every day. I want to taste something a bit more refined. Something like golden apples.
Could you help a lady in distress? Bring me 5 golden apples to sample from, and I'll procure you a diamond block. That should leave a sweet taste in your mouth, as well.
Golden apples can be found in various dangerous corners of the world. If you don't fancy exploring, you can craft golden apples by combining an apple with gold ingots.

plots: NONE
title: Lair of the Manticore
objective: bring the skin of the Manticore to the Sphinx
description:
My ancient charge, to guard the gate
The desert sands to contemplate.
In Stygian realm lurks beast of yore
Part drake, part lion: Manticore.
Lay its skin before my eyes
And passage through shall be your prize.

plots: the player is a Shadowmaster of the Shadow Thieves
Sir Greshal has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a Shadow Thieves' contact here in the city: that contact will be the player
Ama will dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal after the player meets her
title: Government Relations
objective: help Ama kill Sir Greshal
description:
My name is Ama, and I am Shadowmaster of Eastern Esmeltaran.
I would like you to participate in a little rendezvous and help in the removal of a pest. There is a government official, Sir Greshal, causing us no end of trouble with his tariffs and spot checks on caravans. This fool thinks he can stifle the thieving trade of an entire city. He has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves, and while we could pay, it is better that we send a message to any of his cohorts. I have come here with a promise of granting his wishes, but I only want to lure him away from his palisade defenses. This is where you come in.
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a contact here in the city, and that contact will be you. The meeting is already set up, and when he arrives, we will take him by surprise. You are known somewhat in this place, if not as a guildmaster. He will believe you are a legitimate contact. He seems willing to believe anything, so long as it is theatrical.
It will be any evening that is best for you. I will await you in Waukeen's Promenade after dark and then dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal. The suddenness will seem dramatic to him.

plots: the player is the Arch-Mage
the player should have the Staff of Magnus
title: Aftershock
objective: take care of a magical disturbance
tasks: contain the power from the Eye of Magnus with the Staff of Magnus
description:
There is something you should be aware of, Arch-Mage. We've been contacted by the Jarl of Markarth. It would seem there's some sort of disturbance.
From what few details we were given, it sounds quite familiar. I suspect that the power released by the Eye of Magnus was not fully contained, and has coalesced in this part of Skyrim. I do hope you still have the Staff of Magnus someplace. I suspect you're going to need it to contain the power.
I'm sure the Jarl will be quite pleased to. I think it only fitting that the Arch-Mage personally receive a large portion of the reward.

BG2176: within the city in tombs such as this one
BG2177: within the city in tombs such as this one

plots: Kangaxx has been cursed to eternal entrapment in this tomb by his enemies
Kangaxx's curse can be reversed by collecting the pieces of his body: he will become mortal again
title: Restore Kangaxx's Body
objective: reverse Kangaxx's curse
tasks: find Kangaxx's arms, legs, and torso
description:
I am Kangaxx, and I have been cursed. I am dead yet not dead.
Cursed to eternal entrapment in this tomb by cruel enemies! Cursed to a fate worse than death! But the curse can be reversed! With your assistance, I may live again. I have suffered for so long... will you help me?
The fiends that did this to me keep me from returning by tearing apart my mortal form and keeping the pieces separated. You must find my body that I might again take mortal form. The pieces are very close! I have no doubt that they lie within the city in tombs such as this. My enemies are predictable if nothing else. Seek my arms, legs, and torso.
I will give you anything you want. Power, riches beyond number! Anything!

plots: Illia just killed a female witch in front of the player
Illia and the witch were supposed to find a human sacrifice: the witch attacked Illia because Illia could not do it
title: Repentance
objective: help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
tasks: follow Illia to the top of the tower
description:
By the gods! I know this looks bad. Let me explain...
I called Darklight Tower home, now I know that was a mistake. I am, or was part of a coven serving the Hagravens that live there. So was she.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill. We needed a sacrifice for the Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things, Hagravens. I can't be a part of that. Gods, I can't run away from this.
I'm going up there to stop her. This cycle must end. I don't know what brought you here, but I could use your help, if you're willing. Follow me. We have to fight our way up the Tower. I don't think anyone else here is about to have a change of heart.

plots: the information Modryn Oreyn got from the Argonian was valuable
the player will be on their own: they should steer clear of their fellow Fighters Guild members
title: Infiltration
objective: infiltrate the Blackwood Company, and find the secret of their success
description:
While the information we got from the Argonian was valuable, we need more. I want you to infiltrate them. See how they work from the inside.
I want you to get to Leyawiin and join the Blackwood Company. Find the secret of their success. You'll be on your own. Steer clear of me and all of your Fighters Guild brothers. It'll be rough going, but you can do it.
Good luck.

TESO310: Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district

plots: the player has obtained Ayleid artifacts for Umbacano before
Herminia Cinna refuses to sell the Crown of Nenalata to Umbacano
Umbacano needs to go to Nenalata in order to bring his research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage
title: Secrets of the Ayleids
objective: escort Umbacano to the Throne Room of Nenalata
tasks: try to buy the Crown of Nenalata from Herminia Cinna
description:
I have another job for you. This is not quite in your usual line of work, but I hope you can help me just the same.
A rival collector has an item, the Crown of Nenalata, which I very much want to add to my collection. But she stubbornly refuses to consider any of my offers. She and I have had our differences over the years, I admit. Now she is taking this opportunity to get her revenge. I believe that you may be able to persuade her to part with the item, where I cannot due to her prejudice against me. Her name is Herminia Cinna. She lives here in the Imperial City, in the Elven Gardens district.
I hope you will succeed where I have so far failed. Afterwards, in order to bring my research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage, I need to go to the Throne Room of Nenalata. While I am not without means of defending myself, I believe you would be an invaluable companion on such an expedition. Your reward will be whatever plunder you wish to carry off from Nenalata. Since the Throne Room has been sealed since the time of the Ayleids, it should provide rich pickings.

plots: NONE
title: Drienne's Cat
objective: bring Pixie to Drienne
description:
I'm just a little girl Drienne.
Mommy says if you ever need to know something important, you should ask an adult. Pixie, my cat, she was playing close to the waterfall and slipped... I hope she's all right.
You can have this scroll Daddy gave me, if you find Pixie. I can't read the words yet anyways.

plots: NONE
title: A Fair Wage
objective: convince Torbjorn Shatter-Shield pay his Argonian dockhands fairly
description:
Torbjorn Shatter-Shield is giving me trouble. I wish someone would beat the coin out of his fat fists. He clings to every coin.
He says an Argonian's labor is only worth a tenth of a "proper Nord worker." My people are not slaves! You can try talking with him, but we've gotten nowhere talking to him ourselves.

plots: the player asked Oengul War-Anvil whether he is the castle blacksmith
Oengul War-Anvil is working an a sword: the Jarl of Windhelm wants it to look like High Queen Freydis' sword
title: The Queen's Sword
objective: retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
description:
Of course I am the castle blacksmith. What do I look like, a tavern wench? Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary. Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place, Cronvangr Cave.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.

plots: NONE
title: Argonian Ale Extraction
objective: bring Brenuin a bottle of Argonian Ale
tasks: steal the bottle f Argonian Ale
description:
I'm drunk only if I can help it. But damn if I ain't almost sober.
Hey. In the Bannered Mare, there's this bottle of Argonian Ale. The good stuff. Get it for me. They won't even know it's gone. Come on...
Argonian Ale! I can almost taste it! I have something for you. This here healing potion. I, er, "found" it in a temple.

plots: Danno bought a love potion from Wallace at the market square: Danno gave Pala the love potion
Pala drank the love potion and collapsed
title: Save Pala
objective: save Pala from poisoning
description:
Oh, Mazzy! Thank the gods that I've found you! I've hurt Pala!
You have to save her! I didn't mean to do it. I bought a love potion from Wallace the peddler at the market square. I just wanted her to love me. She only had a sip of it, and she collapsed.
She is with your mother, Mazzy. How was I to know it was poison? Oh, please hurry! I will meet you in Trademeet.

plots: Judas wants knowledge
the player is a famous hero
Judas gives the player an enchanted trident: the player can channel lightning with it during thunderstorms
title: Electric Shock Therapy
objective: hit Test Subject with lightning, and report back to Judas
tasks: go to Test Subject when there's a thunderstorm
description:
As a cleric, my duty is to heal the villagers of Woodland Homestead both spiritually and physically. As a hero, your duty is to help people in trouble.
I sometimes devise new treatments for various illnesses: some of my experiments are successful, the others, sadly, not so much. I would like you to assist me with an experiment. I also have a volunteer participating in the experiment as well: a depressed man from this very village.
I need you to go to the Desolate Plains, the desert just outside this village, and hit that test subject of mine with lightning when there's a thunderstorm. For this, I'm giving you an enchanted trident: you can use it to channel lightning during thunderstorms.
Finally, you should report back to me, and let me know what happened. You can keep the trident.
May the Gods be with you, hero!

plots: Baba wants comfort
NONE
title: Here Kitty, Kitty, Kitty
objective: bring a cat to Baba
description:
Hello. I'm Baba. My parents don't know how to tame animals. I want a kitty. You can have my allowance, 16 emeralds, if you bring me a kitty cat.
Can I please have a cat, traveler? You must know how to tame kitties.
Pretty please? Tame a cat and bring it to me.

plots: Romeo wants comfort
the player is a famous hero
title: A Rose, My Darling
objective: bring a rose to Romeo
description:
Great timing, Hero. I'm suffering... my poor heart is writhing in love.
Help me find a rose for my loved one, so that my heart may yet calm down. All I need is but a single rose. They can be found in various temperate forests.
Please, help a fellow in love. I have 27 pumpkin pies I can give you.

plots: Gunmar and Sorine Jurard think that the Dawnguard are going to need Florentius to help against the vampires
Florentius had regular contact with the Vigilants: Isran has kept track of the Vigilants
title: Bolstering the Ranks
objective: find Florentius and recruit him into the Dawnguard
tasks: ask Isran whether he knows where Florentius is
description:
These vampires are a new threat, and a truly deadly one. Gunmar and I agree that we're going to need Florentius to help.
Gunmar and I have a lot of work to do here, so we were hoping that maybe you could track him down. He's a priest of Arkay. Well, he was. It's... it's complicated. Florentius's a little eccentric, but we can trust him and we could definitely use his skills.
Here's the thing. We don't know where Florentius is. Haven't seen him in years. I think he had regular contact with the Vigilants, and I know Isran kept track of them... So maybe you could ask Isran if he knows anything?
Just keep in mind that Isran... well, he might not like the idea. The two of them just never got along.

BG1156: in the hills west of Beregost, close to the High Hedge
BG1158: in the hills west of Beregost, close to the High Hedge

plots: NONE
title: Perdue's Short Sword
objective: kill the gnoll who stole Perdue's short sword
description:
Hullo. The name's Perdue.
There's a gnoll 'oled up in the hills due west of 'ere, close to the High Hedge. Damn thievin' ball-o-fur stole my short sword two days back. The sword ain't worth the tin she's made from.
I'll give ya 75 gold pieces just to seal that yappin' mouth of 'is for good.

TESS7: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest

plots: the ritual of the Ancestor Moth: the player must remove the bark from a canticle tree with a draw knife to attract Ancestor Moths to them
title: Unseen Visions
objective: read "Blood"
tasks: perform the ritual of the Ancestor Moth to gain the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls
description:
Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest.
Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek. It involves carefully removing the bark from a Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you.
In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife. Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it... you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls. From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.

plots: NONE
title: The Whispering Door
objective: find out why Nelkir has become brooding
description:
My youngest son, Nelkir, is a dark child. I don't know what to do with him.
He was always a quiet lad, but lately... something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent. He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him.
If you could speak to him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful.

plots: the ash storms fill up Kolbjorn Barrow faster than Ralis Sedarys can dig
title: Unearthed
objective: become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
tasks: give 1,000 gold to Ralis Sedarys so that he can hire some diggers from Raven Rock to dig up Kolbjorn Barrow
description:
The name's Ralis. Ralis Sedarys, out of Mournhold.
I've got a financier waiting for me back on the mainland. Sent me here in the interests of obtaining some rare antiquities. The 'Relics of Ahzidal.' But this whole thing became a disaster right quick, let me tell you.
You come out to the northern ashlands, you don't expect things to go easy, you know? But this was something outside my particular expertise. When I first got to Kolbjorn, you couldn't even see it. Buried in the ash, like most other things on this blasted island. Dug out a pile of the stuff taller than me just to find the barrow. Who knows how much to reach the door. Excavating isn't exactly my specialty. Even if it was, the ash storms fill it in faster than you can dig.
Could you become my business partner? We can sort out the details of our little arrangement later, but for now, I'll manage the dig if you can manage the coin.
When you have 1,000 gold for me, I'll head back to Raven Rock and round up some diggers. Once we've got something worth looking at, I'll send word to you.

BG1222: near a small shack to the north
Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee
BG1223: Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee

plots: NONE
title: The Fishermen and the Priestess
objective: force the Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee to leave the fishermen alone
tasks: find the Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee
description:
We're being harassed by a Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee. We don't even know why, but whenever we attempt to fish she turns the weather sour. Two of us were washed away just walking to the docks, but we cannot prove to the guard it was her. We be needin' someone to strong-arm her into leaving us alone.
We've not much money, but I'll gladly give you a... magical weapon from my grandfather's adventuring days. It's a meager amount for your trouble, but it would be a great service to us.
Will you help a group of poor fishermen? She hides out near a small shack to the north. Watch yer back and act quickly; she's tricky.

plots: thieves stole Shahvee's sacred amulet of Zenithar as soon as she bought it
title: Good Fortunes
objective: retrieve Shahvee's amulet for her
description:
I'm Shahvee.
We Argonians have not fared well outside our native Black Marsh, but we're determined to make the best of things.
I began praying to Zenithar, the god of wealth, to bring us some fortune, but thieves made off with my sacred amulet almost as soon as I bought it.
If you found my Amulet, Shahvee would be in your debt, kind one.

MC16: ancient ruins, and deep within the Overworld itself
MC17: ancient ruins, and deep within the Overworld itself

plots: Paul wants comfort
NONE
title: Our Father in the Sky Like the Diamonds
objective: bring 9 diamonds to Paul
description:
My child, my temple could use a donation. I have to tend the sick and needy: I cannot procure all my potion ingredients myself. I often have to participate in rather complicated trades for the ingredients.
Please, help a humble servant of the Gods: bring me 9 diamonds. I know that they are rare, but you can find still find them in ancient ruins, and even deep within the Overworld itself.
I have a vast surplus of some potion ingredients that cannot be traded further: I can give you 64 Glowstone Dust for your time and effort.

plots: Medresi Dran's work force ran away while excavating Angarvunde: they opened a chamber full of undead
title: Medresi Dran and the Wandering Dead
objective: discover the treasure of Angarvunde
tasks: clear the main chamber of restless undead
description:
I'm on the verge of incredible wealth, but my cowardly work force ran at the first sign of danger. We were excavating this old tomb when we opened a chamber full of corpses. The team took one look, turned tail, and ran.
Legend says this tomb holds a treasure that bestows great power on the one who discovers it. Beyond that, not much more is known. Obviously, this treasure will fetch a good deal of gold, and I'm willing to let you share in the reward when we find it.
I'll tell you what. You help me get the treasure and I'll split it with you. First, I need you to clear the main chamber of those restless dead. I'll stay here until you're finished, planning our next move.
With my brains and your brawn, that treasure will soon be mine... uh, ours.

plots: NONE
title: The Eve of War
objective: save the Guardian of Mana from the Alchemist and Netherim
tasks: seek the Forsaken Vaults, and convince the Sphinx to grant you entry
description:
I have been expecting you. I am the Guardian of Air.
The Guardian of Mana has pursued the Alchemist into the Forsaken Vaults, which are guarded by the Sphinx. Seek the Vaults, and convince the Sphinx to grant you entry. The Guardian of Mana is in great danger... if not from the Alchemist, then from the Netherim. Save her.

plots: Shadr thinks that Sapphire cheated him: Shadr ordered a shipment from the Whiterun stables, it never came
title: Stabilized
objective: help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire
tasks: talk with Sapphire about Shadr's debt
description:
I owe a great deal of money to someone and I think they cheated me. I don't know what to do.
I was able to work out a deal with the stables in Whiterun to sell me some of their tack and harnesses. I borrowed some gold from Sapphire to pay for the shipment, but it got robbed before it even arrived. Now Sapphire wants her money back, and if I don't pay her, I think she's going to kill me.
Can you help me pay off my debt? You should go talk with Sapphire about it.

TESO128: Waterfront District of the Imperial City
TESO130: Waterfront District of the Imperial City

plots: this is the player's first assignment
the pirates have been moving cargo: the player may be able to smuggle themselves onboard the Marie Elena in one of the packing crates
the player's fellow assassins provide insight about any current contract
title: A Watery Grave
objective: assassinate Gaston Tussaud
description:
Warmest greetings to you. I am Vicente Valtieri. I'm eager to see how you fare on your first assignment.
Go to the Waterfront District of the Imperial City. There you will find a ship named the Marie Elena. Board the ship and find its captain, Gaston Tussaud. He'll be in his cabin. Eliminate Tussaud in any manner you see fit. As a pirate, Gaston Tussaud has certainly spilled his share of blood. Someone wants revenge, and they've hired us to extract it.
The pirates have been moving a lot of cargo onboard lately. You may be able to smuggle yourself onboard in one of the packing crates. Oh, and one more thing. Get into the habit of asking your fellow assassins about any current contract. Their insight may prove invaluable.

plots: NONE
title: A Precious Horse
objective: save Arvak from Soul Cairn
description:
You must help me find my Arvak. He doesn't deserve to be in a place like this!
Arvak is my horse. We came to this horrible place together. We were attacked by monsters, so I told him to run.
Please, he's such a loyal creature, and he's been running for so long. You have to save him! A place like this will change you...
If you find him, I'll teach you how to call him to you. I'm sure he'd be much happier someplace sunnier.

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Teekeeus
Earana and Teekeeus have an unpleasant history: Earana does not care for Mages Guild regulations, and believes Teekeus is mis-using his powers
title: Teekeeus' Old Rival
objective: find a way to get rid of Earana
description:
I'm afraid I can't just write one out of hand. That would be against protocols, you see. If perhaps you can clear up a small matter involving Earana, you can prove your loyalty to the guild and earn my recommendation.
Earana and I have an unpleasant history. She does not care for Guild regulations, and errantly believes I am mis-using my powers. I have seen that she is in town. Though she has not approached me, I know she wants something.
I would like you to find out what it is. Determine what Earana's after, and how we may be rid of her. I do not want her here, spreading her lies.

plots: the player helped Widget and his cousins in the past
title: Fade's Passage
objective: ask Fade to open the hidden passage to Cacklespit's realm
tasks: search for the shrines that mark Fade's resting place
description:
Since you helped us in our time of need, we have been searching for a way to return the favor.
It seems you've met with some unexpected trouble from Cacklespit the witch. I've done a little research, and if you'd like to find her, I think I can help!
From the lore I've been able to piece together, there is a secret way to her hidden realm. The spirit, Fade, can open the way - but he may ask for something in return. You'll have to journey to the Sundered Battlefield in the north. Search for the shrines that mark Fade's resting place. I hope this helps you on your way! I'll keep researching in hopes of finding more information to help you.

plots: NONE
title: A Shattered Visage Lies
objective: help the Faceless King reunite the Zeraphi and Ezrohir
tasks: find the Royal Masks, and bring them to the Faceless King
description:
I am called the Faceless King, and I have resided here since the Zeraphi and Ezrohir were one race. I was their king. It has been my dream to reunite them by accessing the Vault of Souls, but the Vault will not open without the masks of the royal line, which were stolen from me ages ago.
If you can locate the Royal Masks and return them to me, I can unlock the Vault of Souls, and reunite the Zeraphi and Ezrohir! Please, my mortal friend... help me end this war.

plots: the player is the newest member of the Thieves Guild
Hieronymus Lex collected taxes from the Waterfront: the city usually doesn't bother collecting taxes from the Waterfront District, because it costs more money than its worth
the Gray Fox has always protected the poor of the Waterfront
title: Untaxing the Poor
objective: steal back the taxes of the poor Waterfront citizens
tasks: find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and tax records
description:
Ah! Our newest member. I'm glad you stopped by. I have a... situation that you might be able to help with.
The Gray Fox has asked me to take care of a problem, and I'm putting you on it. Hieronymus Lex actually collected taxes from everyone living here on the Waterfront! Your job is to recover those taxes.
The people of the waterfront are very poor. Traditionally the city has not collected taxes from them, even though by law they could. The money the city would collect would barely cover the cost of collecting. The Gray Fox has always guaranteed protection to the poor of the waterfront. He doesn't want to let this injustice stand. It's a matter of principle.
Find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and bring them to me. I'll also need the tax records of what each citizen paid so we can return it.

plots: Narcissos wants comfort
the player is not wearing any kind of armor
title: A Fancy New Shirt
objective: give a leather tunic to Narcissos
description:
Aren't I just the handsomest man in this village? I'd like to become even flashier than I am now.
Even you, traveler, lack any kind of flashy armor. I could give you my old, crummy diamond chestplate so that you'd look a bit less embarrassing.
However, I want you to give me a brand new leather tunic in return.

plots: this is the player's last trial
title: The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller
objective: retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller
tasks: find the horn of Jurgen Windcaller in his tomb
description:
You are now ready for your last trial. Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav.
Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return. Then it is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.

plots: NONE
title: Thane of Winterhold
objective: gain the honorary title of thane of Winterhold
description:
There is room in my court for a new Thane. It's an honorary title, mainly, but there are a few perks someone like you could make use of.
However, I could only grant the title to someone who is known throughout my Hold.
You help my people, and I'll make you my Thane.

plots: NONE
title: Fetch the Netch
objective: obtain five samples of Netch jelly for Milore Ienth
description:
I'm proud to say that I grow or harvest most of my exotic ingredients myself.
I only wish I had a better source for Netch jelly. Those creatures are difficult to track down since it's so dangerous beyond the the town walls.
Could you gather some Netch jelly for me? That would be splendid! Five samples should be enough. I'd be more than happy to give you something for the effort.

plots: guards do not let anyone in the circus tent
title: Find Giran's Mother Within the Circus Tent
objective: investigate the circus tent
description:
sniff* My momma's still inside. They says she can't come out. My momma went into the tent to see a circus show. But somethin' happened, and now nobody comes out. There's guards who won't let nobody in anymore, too. But my momma's in there!
I want my momma! Please find her, please!

TESS802: around the main gate of Windhelm
TESS803: around the main gate of Windhelm

plots: the player saved Malborn from the Thalmor in the past
Malborn could not leave Windhelm for Morrowind because of the Khajiit
title: Assassin at Large
objective: kill the Khajiit who wants to assassinate Malborn
description:
Oh, it's you. I didn't expect to see you again.
I'm trying to stay alive. I think time's running out though. I'm pretty sure the Thalmor know where I am. Maybe you can help me.
I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere, that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave Windhelm so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.
You'd be saving my life. Again. I know I probably seemed ungrateful... I've just been so scared. Expecting a knife at my throat any minute.

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Carahil: the player is new to the Mages Guild
the Council of Mages has entrusted Carahil to take care of an issue of merchant killings along the Gold Road
a rogue mage is suspected of the merchant killings: the only link between the victims is the Brina Cross Inn
battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn
the player can learn Restoration while facing a life and death situation
title: Blood Money
objective: investigate a number of merchants' deaths along the Gold Road
tasks: speak with Arielle Jurard about further instructions
description:
So you are here for your recommendation? Unlike some frivolous tasks you may be given at other guild halls, this is a serious matter, and has consequences. Are you prepared?
Allow me to explain the task. The Council of Mages has entrusted me with resolving a situation along the Gold Road. Several traveling merchants have been found dead along the Gold Road recently, with even more missing. The Council has asked that I put a stop to it. You are going to help me do so.
As you are new to the guild, you are less likely to be recognized as a member. This may give you an advantage in getting to the root of the problem. We believe the killings are the actions of a rogue mage. Battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn, the only common link between the victims.
You are to travel north to the Brina Cross Inn, and speak with Arielle Jurard. She will give you further instructions.
This is a harsh, dangerous task for you, I realize. Your unfamiliar face makes you most useful, however. And, what better way to learn the many uses of Restoration? Practical application is often the best educator. Even in life and death situations.

plots: Albert gives the player Rufie's chew toy to draw out Rufie
title: Albert and His Dog
objective: bring Rufie to Albert
description:
Hi! I'm Albert.
'Scuse me. I ever so sowwy to bother, but could you help me? I've lost my little dog Rufie and I can't find him. He's probably ever so scared wight now. Poor Rufie isn't used to strange places an' people. You're sure to know him when you see him, 'cuz he's just the cutest little thing. Here, take this as well. His favorite chew toy, it is. He'll know you're a friend if you have it in your hands.
I have a small reward for you: it's another of his chew things, but we can get more where we're going.

plots: NONE
title: Wind and Sand
objective: retrieve a copy of "Wind and Sand" for Neloth
tasks: find a copy of "Wind and Sand"
description:
I've been trying to adapt Redguard magic to the ash. I think the key concept I'm missing is recorded in Afa-Saryat's book, Wind and Sand.
I have some associates and correspondents who find things for me. One of them has a credible rumor on where this book might be. And I'd like you to find the truth of the matter.
Go to Druadach Redoubt and fetch the book for me, will you?

plots: the player has done assignments to Bodhi before
Palern Flynn betrayed the Shadow Thieves: the Shadow Thieves have been questioning Palern Flynn ruthlessly for some days
Palern Flynn will be killed once the Shadow Thieves are through
title: A Rescue Mission
objective: do not let the Shadow Thieves kill Palern Flynn
description:
I will give you your next assignment.
The Shadow Thieves have other enemies besides me. Recently, they uncovered a traitor, and have been questioning him quite ruthlessly for some days now.
You will rescue him. He will be killed once they are through, so go quickly. They have him at the Shadow Thief guild house on the second floor. You know the building, I think? The man's name is Palern Flynn. Remember, if he dies, you fail.
Good luck.

plots: NONE
title: Protecting the Bloodline
objective: destroy a vampire before it turns its bandit allies into vampires
description:
A feral-blooded has holed up with a group of bandits. Likely wants to create a nest of broodlings.
We don't need competition for blood, and we don't want the mortals getting up in arms making things difficult for us. Go destroy the feral beast before this becomes a problem.

plots: NONE
title: Silence at Last!
objective: assassinate Lurbuk
description:
Your next assassination target is Lurbuk. He is staying at Moorside Inn in Morthal.
Lurbuk is, by all accounts, the worst bard in all of Skyrim. No one would hold it against you if you flayed that horrible bard alive and made a drum from his skin... Apparently so many people sought his death, a lottery had to be arranged to determine the client.
The only good bard is a dead one, as far as I'm concerned. All that singing and... mirth.

plots: Umbacano has invited the player here to his house: the ancient Ayleid statue that the player recently sold cheap to an anonymous merchant is placed on a table
title: The Collector
objective: recover the complete set of 10 ancient statues for Umbacano
description:
Thank you for coming.
You may recognize that statue over there on the table. The very one that you recently sold -- for less than its true worth.
As you may know, I am somewhat of an enthusiast for Ayleid antiquities. In my own modest way, I have amassed a rather considerable collection.
I have recently become interested in obtaining the complete set of these ancient statues. I believe that ten still exist within the various ancient Ayleid Ruins. No mere shopkeeper knows their true worth.
If you bring them to me when you find them, I will pay you double for each one.

MC221: note blocks, used to play musical notes
MC223: note blocks, used to play musical notes

plots: Zana wants reputation
the player is an enemy of Zana
the player can craft note blocks from wooden planks and redstone dust
title: Notes in Blocks
objective: bring 24 note blocks to Zana
description:
I am most certainly not going to sing your praises, you nasty cretin.
On the contrary, it would be music to my ears if you helped me reach my musical ambitions. No one in this village seems to care for music, or any of the arts for that matter. For starters, obtain 24 note blocks. It has to be exactly 24, because there are that many different notes to play. It's possible to craft note blocks from wooden planks and redstone dust.
Bring the 24 note blocks to me. I'll let you have an old music disc of mine.

plots: Aleron Loche wasted Ursanne and his hard earned money on bets: Aleron Loche wanted to move him and Ursanne to the Imperial City
Aleron Loche borrowed money from Kurdan gro-Dragol: Aleron Loche owes Kurdan gro-Dragol 500 gold
Aleron Loche did not return home after meeting Kurdan gro-Dragol at the Lonely Suitor Lodge yesterday
title: Caught in the Hunt
objective: find Aleron Loche
description:
I'm Ursanne. I'm sorry to impose upon you like this, but I'm in need of assistance, and I don't know what to do. My husband, Aleron, is missing.
It all started when Aleron became foolish, and started gambling. He'd visit the arena every week and spend our hard earned money on bets. I told him to stop, but he didn't listen. He was certain he could win us a fortune and move us somewhere nicer, like the Imperial City. It didn't take long for Aleron to begin losing. He resorted to borrowing money from a usurer to cover his losses and place new bets. As you can imagine, it didn't pay off. He ended up owing around 500 gold. We could never have that kind of money to pay back the usurer.
Yesterday, the usurer, Kurdan gro-Dragol, sent for my husband to meet him at the Lonely Suitor Lodge. He hasn't returned since. I fear for his life. Kurdan isn't known for his patience. Please, I'm not wealthy, but I'd give anything to see Aleron again. Please, find Aleron.
Farewell, and be careful, Kurdan is not to be trusted.

plots: the player and Jauffre won't like Martin's plan to obtain a Great Sigil Stone
Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates: the Mythic Dawn opened a Great Gate at Kvatch, and they want to open another one here to destroy Bruma
Martin was at Kvatch and saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine
the only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma
title: Defense of Bruma
objective: have the Countess meet Martin in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war
tasks: explain Martin's plan to the Countess
description:
We need a Great Sigil Stone. You're not going to like it. Jauffre doesn't like it. The Countess of Bruma certainly isn't going to like it. Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates. The kind of gate the Mythic Dawn opened at Kvatch. The kind of Gate the Mythic Dawn wants to open here to destroy Bruma.
The risk is great, I know. I was at Kvatch. I saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine. But we have no choice. The only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma.
Please, my friend. I explain myself to you so you understand me. And so you can explain to the Countess. I'm afraid she may take a bit more convincing than you.
Have the Countess of Bruma meet me in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war. That seems a fitting place to make such desperate plans.

plots: NONE
title: Lisbet's Missing Shipment
objective: recover a stolen Dibella Statue for Lisbet
description:
This store would finally be on its feet if I hadn't lost my last shipment to Forsworn attacks. A specially-made Dibella statuette.
You aren't for hire, are you? A sellsword? I'll pay you if you can recover that statuette from the Forsworn at Broken Tower Redoubt.
I'll have a sum of gold waiting for you when you return.

plots: Loki wants reputation
the player can craft Ender Chests somehow
title: A Box of Tricks
objective: give an Ender Chest to Loki
description:
I'm planning all sorts of new pranks that would make me a famous man here in the village. There's one integral item that I haven't been able to obtain: an Ender Chest. You know, the chests whose contents are stored separately for everyone?
I heard you can find Ender Chests in End Cities at the end of time and space. It should also be possible to craft them somehow. Can you obtain an Ender Chest? I would pay you well for one: you could have some powered rails that I used in one of my pranks.

plots: the player read "The Aetherium Wars"
title: Lost to the Ages
objective: search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
tasks: find Katria's journal, which contains her notes about the Aetherium Forge
description:
The name's Katria. I am - was - an adventurer. Raided ruins like this for nigh on twenty years. I was on the trail of something big. It led me here, and... I didn't make it.
Oh. You read the book, didn't you? "The Aetherium Wars"? It was my theory, you know. My research. My life's work. All of it, lost! Stolen by my own damn apprentice! That's how I ended up here. I can't rest. Not until I find the Aetherium Forge, until I can prove that it was my discovery. Mine, not his!
Hmm... well, you can pick up where I left off. My notes should still be in my journal, if you can read it. We still have to find the Forge itself. I had a lead on that, too.

plots: NONE
title: No Crown for You
objective: find the Jagged Crown before Galmar Stonefist
tasks: meet Legate Rikke and her men
description:
Ulfric's right-hand man, Galmar Stonefist, has located what he believes is the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. We're going to make sure he doesn't get his hands on it.
The rest of my men are already assembling outside Korvanjund. I'll meet you there as soon as I finish up here.

plots: the player is the Harbinger of the Companions
Skjor and Kodlak talked about totems of Hircine: simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions
title: Totem of Hircine
objective: find a totem of Hircine with Aela the Huntress
description:
Harbinger, I'd be honored if you joined me in my search.
I had once heard Skjor and Kodlak talking about the totems of Hircine. Simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions.
Once Kodlak began looking for his cure, I'd wager Skjor didn't bring it up again. But I was going through his things and found a book I had never seen before. All about the Totems. I've been talking to my sources around the holds, and think I may have heard where one of them lays.
Want to come along and help me find this totem of Hircine?

plots: the player's fellow members of the Fighters Guild have been causing issues at the tavern in Leyawiin
title: Drunk and Disorderly
objective: find out why several of your fellow members of the Fighters Guild are causing trouble in Leyawiin
tasks: find out what is wrong with Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk
description:
Back for more work, are you? Good. Some of our boys are causing trouble in Leyawiin. Looks bad for the guild.
Some of your brothers have been getting rowdy at the local tavern. I've got no problem with cutting loose, but I don't like it when we all look bad. You're looking for Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk. I haven't had any trouble with them before, so find out what's going on.
I'll be waiting.

plots: Arkion was Nemphre's lover
title: Arkion's Amulet
objective: steal Arkion's amulet and bring it to Nemphre
description:
Mmm, be a sweet one. Could you do a favor for Nemphre?
An old lover of mine has followed me here to the city and has been threatening me with some very dark magic. His name is Arkion and, if you could just get a certain amulet of his to me, perhaps there are a few things I could do for you? Such as giving you a Scroll of Vampiric Touch, mmn?

plots: NONE
title: Alchemist in Making
objective: use an alchemy lab to mix a couple of ingredients together
tasks: mix Wheat and Blisterwort together to make a healing potion
description:
You know how to use an alchemy lab right? Mix a couple of ingredients together, see what happens.
A little Wheat and Blisterwort makes a healing potion, if you didn't know. There's plenty of ingredients for sale, too.

plots: the player has met the spirit of the grove before
the player is a child of nature: a druid
Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods
Marek of Halruaa's old enemies have returned to haunt his descendants: Loren's parents were killed by an evil that haunts him
title: Rescue Loren
objective: aid the spirit of Marek of Halruaa in saving Loren
tasks: save Loren from Marek of Halruaa's old enemies
description:
It is I, the spirit of the grove, child.
Child of nature, you are again needed. Balance is threatened, and Chaos is at the periphery. Will you serve the grove?
The grove is young in terms of nature and ancient in the years of man. Centuries ago, Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods. Now, as Marek knew would someday happen, his descendants have returned and old enemies marshal their forces. A child called Loren has recently arrived in Trademeet. This child is the inheritor of Marek's spirit, but does not yet have the knowledge to use his power. Surely he shall be slain by the forces of chaos if you do not rescue him. Even now he is alone and in danger, his parents slain by an evil that haunts him. You must find the child Loren in Trademeet and fight Marek's old enemies to save the child's life.
The spirit that once was Marek has gone forth to aid the child... but the spirit is not the power that the man once was and cannot hope to hold out for long. Aid him lest all be lost.

plots: On the second floor of Baenlin's house is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace containing the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair: if the player loosens the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, the head will fall on Baenlin
title: Accidents Happen
objective: assassinate Baenlin by staging an accident
tasks: enter Baenlin's house secretly and avoid Gromm
description:
We need you to stage an... accident. Kill the target in the manner specified, and you'll receive a considerable bonus. The target is a Wood Elf named Baenlin. You will find him at his home in Bruma.
Enter secretly and avoid his manservant, Gromm. On the second floor is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace. Inside are the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair. Loosen the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, and the head will surely fall on Baenlin as he relaxes in his chair, as is custom. If Baenlin is killed in any other manner, or if the manservant Gromm is killed, you will forfeit the bonus.
Now go, and may Death be with you.

plots: NONE
title: Kill the Forsworn Leader
objective: kill a Forsworn leader
description:
Are you a sellsword? I don't like your kind. No honor. No loyalty. Unreliable. But I can't turn away a potential ally in these times. Let's see if you're better than a common mercenary.
My scouts have tracked down one of the Forsworn leaders, hiding out in their blood-soaked camps at Serpent's Bluff Redoubt. Deal with that Forsworn leader.

plots: NONE
title: The Growing Rift
objective: see whether the Rift is closed; if not, close it
description:
Listen: If you're headed out to the Sundered Battlefield, there's something you should know. We were surveying out there, and discovered some kind of... hole, in thin air, in the pit mine we've been calling Gravedeep. The hole is very small, right now, but we could see things inside... powerful things, but horrible. Malign.
If you're going out there, see if you can find the hole. If we're lucky, it disappeared. But, if not, you should do your best to find a way to close it, before the things we saw get through!

plots: the player asked J'baana to train them in lockpicking
title: Lockpicking Training
objective: get the message to J'baana from S'Krivva
description:
Do you have business with me, J'baana?
You ask me to train you in lockpicking? How very arrogant of you. To think that I would aid you out of the kindness of my heart?
Since you are here, and since you want something, you are useful to me. Travel to Bravil, and speak with S'Krivva. She should have a message for me.
Until you have the message from S'Krivva, we have nothing further to say to one another.

plots: NONE
title: Lost Relic
objective: retrieve the Dawnguard Shield for yourself
tasks: kill the Falmer preventing you from getting the Dawnguard Shield
description:
I've been pouring over some of the tomes left here in the keep. Interesting stories, indeed. Seems the previous incarnation of the Dawnguard had, at one time, some interesting toys.
I have located one of their toys. Arkay and I think it could be a great advantage for us. You should look into retrieving it. It is a magical shield that when blocked with, surrounds its wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead. Might come in handy.
You'll be up against the Falmer of Sightless Pit, if I understand Arkay correctly. Nothing you can't handle.

plots: the player told Vinicia Melissaeia that they want to buy a house in the Imperial City
Sergius Verus can sell the player some furnishings for the house
title: Shack for Sale
objective: purchase the house in the Imperial City
description:
Vinicia Melissaeia, Office of Imperial Commerce. You desire a house in the Imperial City?
Why? I mean... of course. All I have available right now is a hovel on the Waterfront. It's yours for mere 2,000 septims. You may give those septims to me.
You'll find the house in the Waterfront District. It's not much to look at. You may want to spruce it up a bit with some furnishings. I'd suggest talking to Sergius Verus at Three Brothers Trade Goods in the Market District.

plots: the Shivering Isles lie through the door behind Haskill
Sheogorath seeks a mortal to act as his Champion
the Gatekeeper dislikes strangers to the Shivering Isles
title: Through the Fringe of Madness
objective: become Sheogorath's champion
tasks: get past the Gates of Madness
description:
I am Haskill, Chamberlain to the Lord Sheogorath.
You approach the Shivering Isles. Through the door behind me lies the realm of Sheogorath, Prince of Madness, Lord of the Never-There.
My Lord seeks a mortal to act as His Champion. Perhaps the Lord Sheogorath will find a use for you. You'll want to pass through the Gates of Madness. Oh, and mind the Gatekeeper. He dislikes strangers to the Realm.

plots: Jesse wants comfort
the player is a friend of Jesse
title: Waters of Life
objective: help the villagers of Desert Refuge obtain a permanent source of water
tasks: build a well in Desert Refuge
description:
Hail friend! It's good to see you. I'd offer you something to drink, but I'm running low on refreshments, and quite thirsty myself. We are in a desert, after all. There's not much water around...
Now that I think of it... You could actually help the whole Desert Refuge by obtaining us a permanent source of water! Build us a well, please. Ahh, I can already taste the fresh water on my lips...
I could give you this bucket of lava in exchange for a well. Just don't do anything mischievous with it, or burn yourself!

plots: the player asked Helvius Cecia to give them Hand to Hand training
Helvius Cecia will not throw a single punch during the sparring match
the rules of the sparring match: 1) the player must not reach for a weapon, 2) Helvius Cecia will tell the player to stop if they hurt him or if the match goes on for too long
title: Hand to Hand Training
objective: prove Helvius Cecia that you deserve his training
tasks: have a sparring match with Helvius Cecia
description:
Hand to Hand training, eh? The real question is, can you fight?
You know, throw a good punch? Can you? I'd like to find out if I'm going to spend time working with you. So are you up for a sparring match?
I'll make it easy on you. I won't throw a single punch. I just want to see what you've got, anyway. So, is it a deal?
If I see you reach for a weapon, I'm calling it off. And if you can actually hurt me, I'll tell you to stop. If this goes on for too long, and I get bored, I'll stop you.
Now show me what you've got!

plots: the player asked Kesh the Clean about speaking with Peryite
deathbell grow in the frozen tundra
the player might find the ruby and silver in a mine
vampire dust comes from vampires
title: An Ill Meeting
objective: make incense with Kesh the Clean
tasks: gather a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust for making the incense
description:
Not everyone has the stomach required to entreat my Lord. He is the pus in the wound. Oh, proper ones curl their noses, but it's pus that drinks foul humors and restores the blood. But Kesh likes you, friend.
There is a way Peryite may speak to us who will take Him in. If you wish to commune with Him, we'll need the incense. Fetch for me a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust. Then I will show you how.
How to gather the ingredients? This one would try a shop. You might prefer the direct route, hm? Deathbell grow in the frozen tundra. You might nip into a mine for the ruby and silver. Vampire Dust is tricky. Vampires, you know.

plots: Rustleif runs the forge together with his wife Seren, who is a Redguard
Seren worries how she will pass along her traditions to Rustleif and her child
title: A Cultured Gift
objective: bring Rustleif "Night Falls on Sentinel"
description:
My wife Seren and I run the forge together. She still smiths even though we found out she is with child.
Our son or daughter isn't going to get much Redguard culture here in Skyrim. I know my wife worries how she will pass along her traditions.
Hey, if you find a book called "Night Falls on Sentinel", could you bring it to me? It's a story from my wife's people. Be good to have.
Don't know what the Redguards see in books, but it would make my Seren happy. Let me show you some tricks around the forge, when you return with the book.

plots: Garth wants reputation
the player is an infamous person
Garth gives the player a lead
title: A Playful Panda
objective: bring a playful panda to Garth
tasks: find a playful panda, and put a lead on it
description:
You have got quite a reputation. Not a very positive one, mind you!
I, on the other hand, seek to become famous in more positive terms: I want to become a zookeeper. For that I'm going to need some animals to showcase. There exist special, playful pandas who love to roll around. I want one.
This is your chance to bring a bit joy to this world: bring me a playful panda for my zoo. First, you have to find one and put a lead on it. Here, take this lead. When you return with the panda, I'll give you a saddle in return.

plots: Thadon is inebriated from withdrawal effects of Felldew
title: Addiction
objective: return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
description:
Ahh yes, THERE you are! You couldn't imagine how long I, Thadon, the Duke of Mania, have been waiting for you. So little to do, and so much time. Hmm, could you, in fact, imagine just how long I've been waiting? I don't think you could, but I might be wrong.
It felt like rather a long time, but then long times get longer when you're standing around thinking about them. A curious thing, that. Long roads get longer too, if you're thinking about them, but what about long words? They don't change nearly as much. Long, short -- it all ends up the same. Dust and tears. Usually tears first, then the dust. Dust can't cry, you see. That would be... well, amusing. You know what's NOT amusing? I don't have my Chalice of Reversal. It makes me sad. When I get sad, I don't care to do much of anything. I certainly don't care to help people who show up on my doorstep wanting something. Are we getting the picture here?
The Chalice of Reversal is one of my favorite toys. Does wonders for creativity. Well, not by itself, but it helps. Is this making sense? Look, you eat the Felldew, then use the chalice, and find the world a much brighter and happier place. Honest. But I don't have it. So I can't eat Felldew, because that would just be bad. I mean, really bad. Find my chalice!

plots: the player has been imprisoned in Cidhna Mine without any reason
title: No One Escapes Cidhna Mine
objective: discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
